loans.name: Mahmaraim

texts.ru: Махмараиму 51 год. Он из района Дж.Руми. В течении многих лет Махмараим работал на земельном участке, сажал овощи и имел несколько плодовых деревьев. Работа на земле нелегкий труд, но он справлялся со всеми обязательствами. Махмадраиму нравиться  заниматься растениеводством, но для него это не достаточно. Он хочет совместить растениеводство и животноводство, закупить скот и создать свой скотный двор. Для осуществления своих намерений сбережение Махмадрахима недостаточно. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Он планирует каждый месяц закупать по трех голов коров и телят, после 30 дней откорма продавать на скотном рынке по прибыльной цене. У него уже имеется свой мини бизнес-план. Он ждет вашей поддержки, чтобы приступить к новой деятельности.
texts.en:
Mahmaraim is 51 years old.  He is from the J. Rumy district of Tajikistan.  He has worked for many years on a piece of land where he has grown vegetables and cultivated fruit trees.  Working from the land has not been easy, but he has coped well with all obligations.  

Mahmarain enjoys working in agriculture, but he feels that he needs to do more.  He would like to combine crop production with animal husbandry, and wants to buy some livestok to create his own barnyard.  However, he does not have enough savings to realize his project and this is the reason why he is taking a loan.  

His plan is to buy three head of cattle every month (cows and calves) and resell them for a profit at the cattle market 30 days later, after having fattened them.  He already has his mini business plan.  He is waiting for your support, in order to start this new activity.

loans.use: to buy three head of cattle (cows and calves) in order to start his own cattle fattening and sales business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana has a rug making business, which she has been running for five years now. She used her loan to buy fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials. She also has a variety store, and she also used the loan to buy grocery items and toiletries. As a widow, she works hard to provide for her family.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies like cloth, needles, fabric, and other materials. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ana hopes to continuously expand her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred lives in the Kitale area, a fertile land known for its vast maize production. He is married and has five children, all of whom are of school-going age. He has practiced mixed farming for ten years. His main sources of income are vegetables, maize, milk, poultry, eggs, and a small business.

He wants to improve his milk production, and thus has requested a loan of KES.62,400 to purchase a dairy cow. This loan will help him improve his family's living standards, and provide a better education for his children. In farming there are challenges that he experiences like pests, diseases, and lack of good control measures.

In the future, he wants to do zero-grazing for his dairy cows; this will double his current production.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Like most people in San Miguel, 53-year-old Dionisio is in the rice farming business. He is married with seven children, four of them ages 9, 12, 15 and 18. 

He still wanted to pursue farming after ten years of working on the land. He works hard and tirelessly under the sun for his children. Dionisio is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for his farm. He aims to increase the profitability of his business, and his income will go to his children’s education and to savings. 

In the future, he hopes that all his children will be successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Lealo

texts.en: Lealo is a 34-year-old woman who is married with five children. She has a small business selling ice cream in her community. Lealo is asking for a loan to pay for her children's school fees and to buy cement, timber and iron roofing for home improvement. Lealo joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cement, timber, iron roofing and pay school fees

loans.name: Angeli

texts.en:
Angeli has a variety store and she used her loan to buy grocery items and toiletries. She also has a bakery, and she used part of the loan to buy ingredients for her bakeshop. Her loan was also helpful for the education of her eldest child. Her income from the business helped her family with their everyday expenses at home. She and her husband are helping each other in managing their business, and in providing for their family.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs, and for her child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Angeli dreams of expanding her business, and hopes that her children will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rozakan

texts.ru: Розакан 47 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Розакан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Розакан занимается животноводством, стартовав 25 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Розакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Розакан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Розакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на приготовление приданного для дочери.
texts.en:
Rozakan is 47 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising two children.  She has a secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which constitutes the main source of income for her family.  She started in this business 25 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Rozakan's hard work, her farming business now comprises two dairy cows, two calves and 15 head of sheep.  She makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her animal husbandry business, Rozakan has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy some cows in order to increase her cattle headcount.

Rozakan plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further increasing her livestock headcount.  She is also planning to save some money to prepare a dowry for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Sarafina

texts.en:
Sarafina is a 23-year-old single mother of one child. Her child is one year and three months old.

She has a retail shop in Naivasha that she has operated for one year. She has applied for her first loan from KADET to enable her to buy stock of cooking fat, flour, sugar etc. With the anticipated profit, she plans to expand her retail shop.

In the near future, she hopes to own a wholesale shop and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, flour, sugar etc.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 49-year-old man who lives in the rural area of Kyakatuuma town, in the central region of Uganda. 

He is in business of cattle fattening, and he does cattle trading at the same time. He has done this business for the past 20 years. He sells his goods to fellow traders all around.  He says he has managed to extend his farm land acreage, allowing him to input more cows for fattening. He also says the loan facility with Ugafode has enabled him to push his children to higher levels of learning.

He hopes to use the facility advanced to him to buy more cows for fattening and also to trade more cows. He also wishes to use some of the money to renovate his dilapidated cow fences to avoid his cows straying onto neighbors’ land.

He confesses to challenges of long drought periods that affect his cattle and also the foot and mouth disease that affects his herd during the rainy seasons.

loans.use: To buy cattle for breeding and trading and to replace some fencing.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: La señora Basilia, tiene 39 años de edad  estudio hasta el nivel primario, por falta de recursos no pudo seguir estudiando, actualmente vive  sola porque su concubino y padre de sus 4 hijos la abandono hace 5 años atrás, desde entonces Doña Basilia  es padre y madre para sus hijos, vive en la casa que construyeron junto a su ex concubino. La señora se dedica al comercio tiene una venta de ropa en el  mercado de su comunidad, ella viaja todos los fines de semana a la ciudad para proveerse de su mercadería, es por eso que ella solicita un crédito para poder aumentar su capital, mejorar su nivel de vida y poder mantener a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Basilia is 39 years old. She studied through primary school. Due to lack of resources, she was not able to continue studying. 

At present she lives alone, because her partner and father of her 4 children abandoned her 5 years ago. Since then, Basilia is both father and mother for her children. She lives in the house that they constructed alongside her ex-partner. She has a business selling clothing at the local market. Every weekend she travels to the city in order to stock up on merchandise. This is why she is requesting a loan - to be able to increase her capital, to improve her quality of life and to be able to support her children.

loans.use: to increase capital for her business selling clothing.

loans.name: Assumipta Jua

texts.en:
Assumipta Jua is forty years old and is married with five kids. Two of her five kids currently attend school. 

She has been selling food at Abila market in Nimule for about five years. Her business success stems from the availability of supplies across the border in Uganda and the ready market provided by the residents in Nimule town. 

With more funding, she will be able to increase her business stock and sell more. This will eventually translate into expanding the business. She has completed the third cycle of the loan she received from Finance (SS) and she repaid excellently. She wants to increase her business stock and to send more kids to school early next year.

loans.use: to buy more onions, tomatoes and maize flour to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala is a 33-year-old who lives with her partner and 7 children.  She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her local community and has been doing this business for three years.  Kalala has requested a loan to purchase cordial, foam cups, sugar, and Chinese Lollies for making ice cakes.  
She joined Kiva's partner SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Kalala will help improve her family's standard of living.  The income from this loan will help to pay her children's school fees and buy cement and iron roofing for home renovations.

loans.use: to buy cordial, foam cups, sugar and Chinese Lollies to make ice cakes to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 37 years old, married to Cecilia and they have five children who are in school.

He has been in the farming business in Ndunyu Njeru for seven years.  He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET after paying his previous loans on time.  This loan will enable him buy fertilizer and pay for labor.  With anticipated profits, he plans to pay school fees.

He hopes to expand his farming business to increase his income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 60 years old and is from San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. She is married with four children aged 16-25 years old. Erlinda is engaged in buying and selling bananas in her community to earn an income. She is asking for a loan to buy cassava and bananas from farmers so she can sell the crops at the market for a profit. Erlinda dreams of improving her business' profitability so she can provide for her family. In the future, she hopes to help her children be successful with their studies.

loans.use: to buy cassava and bananas to sell at the market.

loans.name: Marjana

texts.en: Thanks to you all, Marjana was able to buy some materials that will help her to do some home renovations. Now that she has all the needed materials, she plans on calling construction workers to start doing cheap repairing of the little family house. Thus, she needs your help again.

loans.use: to finish repairing her little family house

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Verónica de 36 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de entre 10 y 24 años de edad. Estudio hasta noveno grado debido a que no tenían las condiciones económicas para poder seguir estudiando.
Es madre soltera y todos los días se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para hacer el desayuno, despachar a sus hijos a la escuela y luego dedicarse a su venta de ropa.
Desde muy joven aprendió con su madre el comercio de ropa, vende en su comunidad y en cantones cercanos todos los días.

El préstamo será usado para reparar la vivienda, en época lluviosa el agua se filtra provocando incomodidad y enfermedades en su familia.

Con el tiempo Verónica espera formalizar su venta y tener el negocio en su casa, quiere tener una tienda  de articular básicos y así mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Verónica is 36 years old, single and has 3 children between 10 and 24 years of age. She studied up until the ninth grade, owing to the fact that they did not have the economic conditions for her to continue studying.

She is a single mother. Every day she gets up at 5 in the morning to make breakfast, send her children off to school and then work on her clothing sales. From a very young age she learned the clothing business with her mother. She sells in her community and in nearby cantons every day.

The loan would be used to repair their home. In the rainy season the water leaks in, causing discomfort and illness for her family.

In time, Verónica hopes to formalize her sales and have the business in her house. She wants to have a store of basic items and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to repair her home.

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en:
Hoda is a 58-year-old married mother of five children. She works as a tailor from her house, and she has twenty-seven years of experience.  Hoda is responsible for the living expenses of one member of her family in addition to her own living expenses. She is acquiring her twelfth loan cycle from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to improve her business productivity through buying necessary tailoring tools and she will invest part of her loan to buy necessary things she might need during her pilgrimage visit. 
As for her future plans, Hoda is working hard to open a separate tailoring shop outside of her house which will provide her family and customers with the preferable privacy.

loans.use: to buy tailoring tools for her business.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: For 15 years now, Alejandra has operated a food business in San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with two adult children. Alejandra is currently engaged in food vending and she sells ice candy (Popsicles), rice cakes (sweetened sticky rice) and pancakes. She is asking for a loan to buy cooking oil, sticky rice and sugar that will allow her to continue her livelihood while also meeting the needs of her household. She is motivated to work hard and earn more so she can improve her present living condition.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sticky rice and sugar.

loans.name: Umar

texts.ru:
Умар бизнесмен, проживающий в районе Гиссар. Он занимается купле-продажей конфет и сухофруктов. Ему 49 лет. Умар женат и является отцом троих детей, которые ходят в школу. Его жена домохозяйка. Таким образом Умар в семье единственный кормилец. Он обеспечивает семью за счет своей торговой деятельности. Он занят в этой сфере уже три года. Умар на рынке района имеет торговую точку, где продает разнообразный ассортимент конфет и сухофруктов. В данный момент он запрашивает кредит для увеличения товарооборота.  
Умар хочет в будущем приобрести магазин и расширить свой торговый бизнес.
texts.en: Umar is a business owner who lives in the Gissar region of Tajikistan; he deals in candies and dried fruits.  He is 49, married, and is the father of three children who are still in grade school.  His wife manages the home, making Umar the only breadwinner in the family.  For the past three years, he has provided for his family by selling his goods at the local market, where he has a stall with a variety of candies and fruits.  In the future, Umar would like to set up his own store and expand his business.  At the moment, he is seeking a loan to stock up on more kinds of candy and dried fruit in hopes of increasing his sales.

loans.use: buy an assortment of candies and dried fruits to increase his sales

loans.name: Jeithan Yeohan

texts.es: Jeithan tiene la edad de 22 años, es un joven de escasos recursos económicos, con su trabajo como asistente en una refinería se apoya  para los gastos de su carrera de Ing. Industrial. Para Jeithan los deseos de superarse son cada día más grandes, ya que graduándose como ingeniero puede optar por estudiar una maestría para poder desempeñarse mejor en su campo laboral, lo que le podría permitir a futuro un ascenso en su trabajo, esto le facilitara apoyar a su familia con sus ingresos. Solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera que actualmente cursa, lo cual va acompañado de un postgrado en Administración Estratégica de Operaciones.
texts.en:
Jeithan, 22, is a young man with few economic resources. He works as an assistant in a refinery to support the expense of his degree in Industrial Engineering. Jeithan's desire to better himself grows each day. Once he graduates as an engineer he can choose to get a masters degree in order to better carry out work in his field. It also may allow him to move up in a future job, the earnings from which would help out his family. 

He asks for a loan to pay for the diploma course that he is currently in, which will be accompanied by a masters in Strategic Operations Administration.

loans.use: to pay for a degree and postgraduate work.

loans.name: Esa

texts.en: Esa is 43 years old and married with 6 children.  She runs a small business selling chips and pancakes in her community and has been doing this for more than 3 years.  Esa has requested a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, raw bananas, frying pan, sugar, salt, baking powder and plastic bags.  She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital.  With her earnings Esa will help improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, raw bananas, frying pan, sugar, salt, baking powder and plastic bags.

loans.name: Al-Mahba Creater Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Mahba Creater Group and it is made up of four women who are natives of Aden, Yemen. Together, they applied for a loan of 180,000 Yemeni Rials.  One of the members of this group is named Maloka.  She has a business selling women's clothes, incense and perfumes. She is 32 years old and married.  She says that she started her business by buying clothes from the first loan until she was able to sell them to customers around her area. She realized that her business was profitable so she set out to invest more in it.  Now, she is applying for a loan of 50,000 Yemeni Rials from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy additional women's clothes for her business. She hopes to have a clothing shop and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn hails from Talibon, Philippines. She is 31 years old and married with four children aged 2-13 years. Jocelyn has been farming rice for 13 years now to provide for her family. She wants to increase her income for her family’s benefit. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings. Any additional income will go to her family’s daily consumption and her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Nouvellement inauguré, ce 18 septembre 2013 ce banc villageois est composé de femmes désireux d’améliorer leurs conditions d’existence via des activités génératrices de revenu. Elles vivent dans un même village depuis plusieurs décennies et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce.
 
Madame Aïssatou, âgée de 41 ans (debout à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de sept enfants dont un garçon et six filles. Elle est vendeuse de poisson sec qu’elle se procure auprès de productrices dans les régions côtières et de piment auprès de maraîchers, pour la revente au détail selon les besoins du client.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 01 panier de 100 kilos à 25 000 F CFA et 02 bassines de taille moyenne de  piment à 1 500 F CFA l’unité.

Les bénéfices me permettent d’une part d’aider mon mari à prendre en charge les besoins de la famille et d’autre part à accroître mon chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
Newly formed this past September 18, 2013, this "banc villageois" is made up of women wanting to improve their living conditions through small business. They have lived in the same village for decades and maintain personal relationships of loyalty and mutual aid. They are all actively running small businesses.

Aïssatou, 41 years old (pictured standing on the far right) is the featured borrower of this group. She is married and the mother of seven children, made up of one boy and six girls. She is a seller of dried fish which she obtains from producers in neighboring regions and of vegetable spices, for resale at retail to meet the needs of her customers.

With this new loan, Aïssatou plans to purchase 1 basket of 100kg at 25,000 francs CFA and 2 medium basins of spice at 1500 francs CFA each. The profits will allow her to help her husband care for the needs of their family and also to increase her business turnover.

loans.use: to purchase 1 basket of 100kg at 25,000 francs CFA and 2 medium basins of spice at 1500 francs CFA each

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 41 years old and married to Peter.  They have four children who are in school.

She has a clothing sales business in Naivasha that she has operated for three years.  She has applied for her first loan from KADET to enable her to purchase clothing stock for resale.  With her anticipated profit she plans to pay school fees and buy more stock for her business.

She hopes to open a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Christabel

texts.en:
Christabel lives in Kitale, Kenya. This is a very fertile land especially known for maize production. Christabel is married and has two children both of whom are of school-going age. She has practiced farming for 6 years.  Her main sources of income are milk, poultry and eggs which she sells at Kinyoro market.  Beside farming, she also owns a bar as an extra source of income.
Christabel wants to expand her poultry farm and thus has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to help her with this project. This will help her generate more income so as to provide basic needs for her family and to provide better education for her children. The challenges she faces are the lack of good control measures for poultry diseases as well as expensive poultry feeds.
In the future, Christabel wants to improve her poultry farm and also venture into dairy farming.  She thanks Juhudi Kilimo for the loan.

loans.use: to expand her poultry farm.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is 26 years old, married, and a mother of five children. She has been running an animal sales and purchase business for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. Currently she is requesting a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is 47 years old, married, and a mother of seven. She has been running a milk selling business with her husband for 4 years. She has two buffalo and sells their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk.  She looks after the buffalo and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it in different places on a daily basis. Razia needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and the education of her children. In order to make huge profits, Razia has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. Razia hopes to have an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Farijika Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mupenda est une commerçante et membre du groupe  d’affaire «  Farijika », âgée  de 32 ans mère de 5 enfants qui étudient. Elle est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires.  Son conjoint, lui aussi est un commerçant de divers. Elle a sollicité un crédit  auprès de Hekima. Elle va  acheter deux sacs de maïs pour accroitre son business.  Elle avait commencé avec ses fonds propre reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir il souhaite construire sa parcelle et changer son statut de locataire. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables. Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Mupenda is a shopkeeper and a member of the borrowing group "Farijika." She is 32 years old and the mother of 5 children who attend school. She is a seller of food products. Her husband is also a shopkeeper who sells various items.

Mupenda is requesting a loan from Hekima. She will purchase two bags of corn to increase her business. She began her business with her own funds received from her husband. In the future she hopes to be able to build her own plot and to change her current status as a tenant. She thanks Hekima for their support of small entrepreneurs not eligible for traditional banking. It should be noted that one of the borrowers is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of corn

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: La  dame   ROKHAYA  est  une  femme  mariée   qui  vit  au  Sénégal.  Elle  s’active  dans  le  secteur  de  l’aviculture  depuis 1an et pratique la vente de poulets. Auparavant  elle n’a jamais contracté de crédit au sein du guichet de l’uimcec ou elle est membre. Présentement  elle sollicite un crédit  de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de poussins à élever. Les revenus qu’elle gagne de son activité de même que l’accroissement de ses bénéfices  a travers ce crédit lui permettront d’augmenter le niveau de son épargne et  aussi de participer a l’amélioration  des conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Elle projette dans le futur d’élargir d’avantage son poulailler.
texts.en:
Rokhaya is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She has been in the poultry business for 1 year and sells chickens. She has not previously taken out any loans from the branch of UIMCEC where she is now a member. She is currently requesting a loan for 200,000 francs CFA to purchase chicks to raise.

The profits that Rokhaya earns in her business as well as the proceeds from this loan will allow her to increase her savings and also improve the food conditions for her family. She plans to further expand her chicken coop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase chicks

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur   ABDOULAYE   vit au Sénégal. Il est marié et    s’active  dans  le secteur   du  commerce  depuis  6  ans.  Il exerce  la  vente  d’habits   prêts  à porter. A l’aide des revenus que lui procure son activité de commerce il parvient   à  supporter  les  charges  familiales  de son foyer  comme  le  loyer  et  les  factures  d’ électricité. Auparavant il n’a jamais remboursé de crédit au sein du guichet de l’UIMCEC ou il est membre. Actuellement il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’acquisition de prêts  a porter qui seront destinés  a renforcer le stock de ses habits a vendre. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices servira a améliorer les conditions alimentaires de vie de sa famille. Son projet dans le futur consiste à faire une extension de  sa cantine.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye lives in Senegal. He is married and has been in business for 6 years. He sells ready to wear clothing. With the help of the earnings from his business, Abdoulaye is able to support his household's needs, such as rent and electricity bills. He has not previously had any loans from the branch of UIMCEC where he is a member.

Currently Abdoulaye is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs CFA in order to purchase ready to wear clothes which will increase his stock of merchandise to sell. The growth of his profits will help improve the food conditions of his family. His future plans include adding an extension to his shop.

loans.use: to purchase ready to wear clothing to resell

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 41-year-old widow and a mother of five. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She gets a lot of appreciation from her community. After her husband‘s death she started the business as she was not able to meet her household expenses with the educational needs of her children. She manages her household work while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for everyday expenses. Shamim has now requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase a new sewing machine along with more reels of thread, packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet her increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Shamim hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine along with more reels of thread, packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Muzaiqa

texts.en: Muzaiqa is a 27 year old married woman and a vigorous mother of three children. She has been involved in the business of machine-embroidery for many years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. Her embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy raw materials such as spools of thread along with packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material in large quantities to complete the orders of her customers on time. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history. She shared her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as spools of thread along with packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and seedlings.

loans.name: Aracely De Jesús

texts.es: Aracely, con 44 años de edad es madre soltera de 2 hijos. Viene de una familia muy humilde y, durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar como recicladora, inicialmente recogían los materiales en el relleno sanitario de la región, pero por un decreto que expidió la alcaldía, esta actividad fue prohibida. A raíz de esto, se formó un grupo de mujeres recicladoras que se vieron afectadas por este decreto, con ellas, Aracely comenzó a desplazarse delante del camión recolector de basura realizando los diferentes recorridos por los barrios de la ciudad, según las exigencias dadas por la alcaldía. Al principio prensaban el material de forma manual, pero poco a poco se fue haciendo más rentable el negocio y adquirió una prensa hidráulica. El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en el pago de mano de obra para separar los diferentes materiales reciclados, para luego ser prensados y evitar un sobrecupo en la bodega en la que almacena los desechos; esto le permitirá agilizar el proceso de separación para luego vender todo lo recolectado y así hacer líquido el dinero que a la fecha se encuentra estancado en la bodega como reciclaje.  Aracely sueña con darle continuidad a su labor para que en un futuro le permita adquirir un vehículo en el que pueda transportar el reciclaje por cuenta propia y así aumentar la rentabilidad en la comercialización, abriendo la posibilidad de brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
44-year-old Aracely is a single mother of 2 children. She comes from a very humble family and, throughout her productive life, she has dedicated herself to working as a recycler. 

Initially, she gathered the materials from the local dump, but because of a decree issued by the mayor, this activity was prohibited. As a result, a group was formed of woman recyclers who were affected by this ordinance. 

Along with them, Aracely began to follow after the garbage truck making the various routes throughout the city neighborhoods, according to the requirements given by the mayor’s office. In the beginning, they crushed the material by hand, but little by little, the business became more profitable, and she acquired a hydraulic press. 

She hopes to invest the loan that she is requesting in paying for manual labor to separate out the different recycled materials, so that they can later be crushed, thereby avoiding an overflow in the storeroom where they keep the garbage. This will allow her to speed up the sorting process, so that she can later sell everything that she has collected and make available the money that has up to now been sitting in the storeroom as recycling material. 

Aracely dreams of continuing with her work, so that in the future, she will be able to obtain a vehicle that she can use to transport the recycling on her own. In this way, she can increase her profitability through commercialization, opening the possibility of offering a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to pay for manual labor to sort recycled material.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Ziad appears in her Kiva profile photo. He is pictured next to the greenhouse they have.

Abeer is a 41-year-old married woman; she is a mother to one son and three daughters. Her husband is a worker across the border who earns a low salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Abeer works in agriculture with the rest of the family members, and she wants to contribute to the purchase of seasonal seedlings to plant in the greenhouse. She is requesting a $2,000 USD loan from FATEN to provide a share of the family's costs of purchasing the seedlings. It will allow them to produce a better crop and thus increase their sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings to plant in the greenhouse.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 31 years old and from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She is married with three children, ages 2, 10 and 12. Her husband works as a fisherman while she helps with the fishing inputs and making sure that his catch will be sold at a good price. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fishing nets and nylon.

Each day, it is her goal to continue improving, and she hopes that in the future, she can continue to support her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and nylon.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is an Iraqi youth client who is 23 years old and lives with his family composed of seven members, of whom three are employed and share the family income together.

Hussain owns a small shop where he sells shoes, sandals and slippers. He established his business in 2011 and has gained much experience in what he practices. Thanks to the good quality of his sold goods, Hussain became well-known in the surrounding area and has gained an excellent reputation.

Hussain is applying for a youth loan of $3,000 USD. He will use this loan to pay the yearly rent of his shop and to buy more shoes to sell. Hussain is aiming to improve his business and open a bigger shop one day, so that he may increase his profits and provide himself a great career.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent of his shop and to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of bananas, yams and cassava.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en:
Honorata practices farming to support her family. She and her family live in Getafe, a town in the province of Bohol, Philippines.  She is married and has three children ages 12, 14 and 18. She and her husband help each other till the land and hope for a good harvest. She applied for a loan knowing that this could help them. The money that they will get will be used to acquire fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labor. They are expecting a better yield on their crops now that they have the means to buy the needed farming maintenance. 
Any income derived from this business will be spent on her family’s daily consumption and future business investments.  In the future, she hopes to see her children become successful with their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay for labor.

loans.name: Gudo

texts.en:
Gudo is a 36-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and has been running a business for many years selling cloths with her husband who is also shown in the picture.  Gudo buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then her husband sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Gudo is requesting a 35,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wider variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Gudo expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend a part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.
 .

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is 34 years old and lives in Gaza, Palestine.  She has more than five years of experience working with kindergarteners and in 2012, she decided to open her own Kindergarten.  She has three teachers and they also have good experience in the field.
Her dream is to see her business expand.  Her Kindergarten is really distinct from other kindergartens in the area, and she hopes to provide the kids with everything they need.
Maha is asking Ryada for this loan to buy toys and furniture for the kids.  She is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy toys and furniture for her Kindergarten.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is 23-year-old married woman and a vigorous lady.  She has been stitching clothes for the people of her community for many years and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.  This will allow her to generate more income. She is in her second loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Jennie Marley

texts.es:
Jennie de 31 años, es madre soltera y tiene una hija que nunca fue reconocida por su padre; trabaja muy duro todos los días para poder tener que comer todos los días.

Desde pequeña, ayudo a sus padres alas labores agrícolas y a cuidar ganado, desde muy temprano se levanta para llevar los animales al campo, luego se que trabajando en el cultivo y regresa después con sus animales.

Para comprar sus animales, Viaja en camión 45 minutos al tiangue de ganado, y luego de la compra regresa en camión a sus casa.


El, préstamo lo necesita  para comprar 4 novillos de engorde, incrementar su hato de ganado, lo que ayudara a que las ventas sean mas continuas.

Jennie esta guardando su dinero para que en un futuro su hija pueda graduarse de una universidad.
texts.en:
Jennie, 31, is a single mother.  She has a daughter whose father never recognized her.  She works very hard every day to be able to have something to eat.

She helped her parents with the farm labor and taking care of the cattle since she was a little girl.  She gets up very early to take the animals to the field, then stays to work on the crops and returns to her animals later.

To buy her animals, she travels 45 minutes on the bus to the cattle market.  After making her purchase, she returns home on the bus.

Jennie needs the loan to buy four young cows to fatten so she can increase her cattle herd, which will help sales be more constant.

Jennie's saving her money so her daughter can graduate from college in the future.

loans.use: to buy four young cows

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna de 36 años, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos y solo uno vive con ella. Solo pudo estudiar hasta tercer grado, su esposo se dedica a trabajar la tierra, su hijo dejo de estudiar y ahora trabaja con su esposo.

Se dedica al comercio: venta de semilla de marañón y pollo de engorde, anteriormente vendía chile verde, lo llevaba hasta San Salvador. Su madre le enseño a trabajar de esta manera,  Cuando se caso comenzó a trabajar también en la agricultura con su marido. Ella vende sus productos  viajando 3 km  desde su casa en autobús.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar terneros de engorde, ve una buena posibilidad por el precio que tiene el ganado en esta temporada.

Reyna desea tener varias formas de ingresos: agricultura, venta de pollos de engorde, venta de semilla de marañón y venta de ganado. Si le fallara un negocio, tiene garantizado siempre el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna is 36 years old. She is married and has four children; only one lives with her. She was only able to stay in school until third grade. Her husband works as a farmer. Her son is no longer in school, and now he works with her husband. 

She is a businesswoman: she sells cashew seeds and chickens for fattening. Previously, she sold green chilies, taking them to San Salvador. Her mother taught her to do this work. When she married, she also began working in agriculture with her husband. She travels 3 kilometers by bus from her house to sell her products.

The loan will be used to purchase calves for fattening. She sees a good chance for the price for cattle this season. Reyna hopes to have several forms of income: agriculture, selling fattened chickens, selling cashew seeds, and selling cattle. If one business fails, she will always have guaranteed support for her family.

loans.use: to purchase calves for fattening.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco de 27 años de edad, es un joven agricultor, acompañado y que tiene 1 hijo de tres años de edad, solo termino sus estudios de educación media, su esposa es ama de casa.

Francisco aprendió a trabajar con sus padres desde muy pequeño, se levanta todos los días a las 5 de la mañana para ir a trabajar con sus esposa en el cultivo caminando cerca de un kilómetro para llegar al lugar. En horas de la tarde presta sus en seguridad privada en una empresa particular,

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una vaca lechera para que su esposa pueda comercializar el producto, ya sea leche o sus derivados

Esperando resultados positivos, francisco planea comprar mas animales y empezar el negocio con ganado.
texts.en:
Francisco is 27 years old, he is a young farmer, he is with someone and has a three-year old son, he only finished his studies of high school, his wife is a homemaker.

Francisco learned to work with his parents since he was very little, he gets up every day at 5 in the morning to go to work with his wife on the crops, walking around a kilometer to get to there.  In the afternoon he provides private security services to a private company.

The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow so that his wife can commercialize the product, either milk or milk products.

Hoping positive results, Francisco plans to buy more livestock and start a cattle business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel tiene la edad de 39 años habita en un barrio marginal de Managua, tiene dos hijos de 19 y 17 años de edad estudiantes de la universidad, Miguel se apoya con su actividad comercial, que es la carpintería elaborando muebles variados en su casa de habitación. Solicita el crédito para construir el muro perimetral de la parte trasera de su casa, el cual es muy peligroso cuando llueve se inunda la casa y las laminas de zinc son un riesgo para sus hijos, con el préstamo comprara bloques, cemento, hierro, piedra cantera, arena. Esta  mejora en su hogar le hará sentirse más tranquilo.
texts.en:
Miguel is 39 years old and lives in a marginal neighborhood in Managua. He has two children who are 17 and 19 years old and study at the university. Miguel supports himself through his job as a carpenter elaborating different types of furniture in his house. 

He requests the loan to build a perimeter wall around the back part of his house, which currently is very dangerous because when it rains the house is flooded and the zinc sheets pose a risk to his sons. With the loan Miguel will buy blocks, cement, iron, quarried stone and sand. This improvement in his home will make him feel more tranquil.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, iron, quarried stone and sand

loans.name: Nathy Reina

texts.es: La señora Nathy es una señora de 45 años de edad, la cual logro salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo a pesar de que su esposo la abandono hace 8 años, dejándola con sus hijos a cargo de ella, los cuales están en etapa escolar y son alumnos regulares pero con ganas de ayudar a su madre en la actividad que realiza, esta actividad es la elaboración de quesillos para lo cual cuenta con 5 cabezas de ganado lechero, los hijos son los que ayudan a alimentar y recolectar la producción de leche, los quesillos son comercializados en un mercado local de la zona en la que viven, el motivo del presente crédito es porque la señora Nathy va a comprar cascara de soya para alimentar al ganado lechero puesto que tuvieron unos gastos inesperados por una enfermedad de su hijo menor el cual ya se encuentra mejor de salud, pero estos gastos hicieron que a la señora le falte para dicho alimento.
texts.en:
Nathy is a 45-year-old woman who has succeeded in getting ahead despite being abandoned by her husband eight years ago. She was left with the responsibility for their children, who are school-aged and attend school regularly even though they wish to help their mother in her work. Nathy produces cheese, for which she has five dairy cows. Her children help her feed the cows and collect milk. The cheeses are sold in a local market in the area in which they live.

Nathy will use the loan to buy soybean husks to feed her dairy cows, since she had some unexpected expenses when her younger son fell ill. He is now in better health, but those expenses meant that Nathy fell short in being able to purchase the feed for her cows.

loans.use: to buy soybean husks

loans.name: Bakhrom

texts.ru: Бахром жизнерадостный и ответственный мужчина в возрасте 54 лет. Он женат и имеет 4 детей. Бахром со своей женой живут счастливо и стараются воспитывать своих детей хорошими людьми. Живут они в маленькой деревушке. Его старший сын и дочь уже имеют свои семьи и детей. Бахром и его жена очень рады  растить своих внуков. Уже на протяжении нескольких лет Бахром занимается своим бизнесом. Он является пекарем, печёт национальные вкусные лепёшки и продаёт местному населению, а также у него покупают лепёшки, как подарок, специально для гостей из других стран. Этот бизнес приносит Бахрому стабильный доход. Этим самым он может обеспечить свою семью, а также он копит сбережения для своих внуков. Сейчас Бахром хочет расширить свой бизнес, для этого ему необходимо закупить больше продуктов для выпечки. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и желает получить кредит на покупку продуктов для выпечки лепёшек. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь в развитии бизнеса.
texts.en:
Bakhrom is a cheerful, responsible 54-year-old who is married and has 4 kids.  He lives with his family in a small village.  Bakhrom and his wife are happily married and try to raise their children to be good people.  He and his wife are happily raising their grandchildren as well, as his oldest son and daughter  already have their own families and children.  

For the past several years, Bakhrom has operated his own bakery, baking loaves of tasty Tajikistani flatbread and selling them to the locals, as well as to tourists from other countries who buy them as souvenirs.  His bakery provides a stable source of income for his family, and also allows him to set aside money for his grandchildren.  At the moment, Bakhrom is seeking to expand his business, and needs to stock up on baking supplies to do so.  To this end, he hopes to receive a loan from Arvand to buy the supplies he needs.  He is hoping for a positive outcome, and thanks Arvand in advance for their help in expanding his business.

loans.use: buy supplies for baking

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is a 36-year-old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He has been engaged in fishing and catching crabs for 5 years now. From this livelihood, he usually earns an average monthly income of 10,000 PHP, which helps for food and household bills. 

Joselito is asking for a loan to buy a screen, fishing nets, and bamboo. He knows that this change will be helpful so he can have better profit. In the future, he hopes to have children and give his family a good life.

loans.use: to buy a screen, fishing nets, and bamboos for a crab trap.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania is a 45-year-old woman with three children ages 18, 22, and 26. She and her family live in Trinidad, Bohol. She has depended on her income from rice farming for more than two decades now. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. This loan will help her so she can get a better return on her investment. She hopes that through this loan, she can further expand her business, making the most profit she can and providing her family's food and income out of her harvest. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger farm to cultivate so she and her family can live in comfort.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de panes chutas,en un pan a base de harina y es dulce,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 16 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de panes.El socio solicita el credito para comprar insumos para preparar los panes como harina y levadura.

El socio esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The borrower continues making a living through his business selling panes chutas [a large, round Peruvian bread], a sweet bread made with a flour base. The borrower works from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. He has had his business for sixteen years and it has been going well for him. His dream is to expand his bread-selling business. The borrower requests a loan to buy ingredients to prepare the bread such as flour and yeast. He is happy with the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare his bread such as flour and yeast

loans.name: Siempre Unidos Group

texts.es:
La socia Estherlin tiene 35 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida y tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a sus negocios el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a cada uno de ellos, la socia vende diferentes productos como arroz, azúcar entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azucar, leche entre otros. 
La socia se siente agradecida con los inversionistas de Kiva y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de celulares, venta de ropa, tienda de abarrotes, venta de papa, venta de comida, preparación de bebidas.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
Los socios que aparece a la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The featured group member, Estherlin, is thirty-five years old.  She has three children and is separated.  She divides her daily activities between her business selling food and her grocery store.  She has been dedicating her time to these businesses for a while, and everything is going well thanks to the effort she puts in everyday.  She sells various products, like rice, sugar, and other items at her grocery store.  She hopes to be able to continue working in this way so that she can continue supporting her family.

This group member is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and other items.  

She is grateful to the Kiva investors and promises to comply with the established payments.

The other group members have businesses selling phones, clothing, groceries, potatoes, food, and preparing drinks.

The individual in the photo with their face blocked out does not belong to the communal bank.  The members that appear in the separate photos asked permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work commitments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and other items.

loans.name: Nertila

texts.en:
Nertila is seeking lenders’ financial help and generosity. She wants to buy some potato seeds for planting now because it is cheaper compared to a bit later when the prices go up. Nertila has already prepared the land for planting. 

For the past six years, she has been selling raw milk to the dairy farms in her vicinity.
She is a 27-year-old married mother of a four years and a ten days old children. The oldest one, her daughter, was born with autism. Kindly note that while Albania had no statistics of autism before, now the number of cases is going up rapidly. Approximately two out of five children are such cases and there is not much accommodation for these kids, unfortunately. 
Parents of these kids have to do it all, and according to them, they don’t even know how to communicate with such kids. They just give adequate love, being aware though that this is not enough in such particular instances.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
Lindita is expected to give birth to a boy very soon, within days. She has two children and is 29 years old. They all live in a village where, according to VisionFund Albania’s poverty measurement tools, the majority of people fall way under the poverty line. 

“Just like so many other people who live in rural areas and practice their skills in agricultural/livestock, I do the same. There was nothing else that I could do. Besides that I’ve got no education but even if I did, the unemployment rate in Albania is high. So, I am content with what I have been pursuing so far; selling raw milk to the village dairy farm and also I sell potatoes, red onions and dried beans to wholesale buyers.” said Lindita.

Lindita is requesting a loan to build a storage room where she can store and dry the onions, potatoes and beans.

loans.use: to build a storage room to store and dry her produce.

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.es: El cliente reside en la zona de Fortín en Guayaquil.  Se decidió a salir adelante con dedicación, montando su propia empresa, por necesidad y superación personal.  Poco a poco ha logrado subir y progresar, pero piensa que necesita más apoyo para hacerlo.  Atiende su tienda solo, desde las 7:30 am hasta las 9 pm, todos los días.  Es divorciado desde hace 4 años y no tiene hijos.  Quisiera en un futuro poder ampliar su negocio para convertirlo en una casa comercial.  Por el momento necesita del crédito para la compra de víveres, cereales y carnes para su tienda.
texts.en: This client lives in Guayaquil’s Fortín zone.  He decided to get ahead by means of dedication opening his own business because of need and for personal improvement.  He’s gradually be able to rise and make progress but he believes that he needs more support to do so.  He tends to his store alone from 7:30am until 9pm every day.  He’s been divorced for four years and has no children.  He’d like in future to be able to expand the business turning it into a commercial house.  For the moment, he needs the loan to buy food items, cereals and meats for his store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Guasmo en Guayaquil.  Empezó tiempo atrás con la venta por catlálogo con unas amigas, luego arregló un cuarto donde puso una copiadora, recargas electrónicas y sus productos de catálogo.  Es madre soltera pero mantiene una buena relación con el papa de sus hijas, ya que le ayuda con los gastos.  Tiene 3 hijas que estudian en colegio y escuela fiscal.  A futuro desea seguir trabajando duro e instalar un cyber.  Ahora necesita el crédito para comprar una copiadora más grande.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the sector of Guasmo in Guayaquil.  A long time ago, she sold catalog products with some of her friends.  She later remodeled a room and installed a copying machine, but she also sells electronic phone credits and catalog products.  The borrower is a single mother who maintains a good relationship with the father of her daughters since he helps with the expenses.  Her three daughters attend state schools.  In the future, she wants to keep working hard and open a cybercafé.  

For now, the borrower needs a loan in order to buy a larger copying machine.

loans.use: to buy a copying machine.

loans.name: Carlos Jacinto

texts.es: El cliente es del sector de Guasmo en Guayaquil.  Aprendió el oficio desde joven y un día decidió trabajar para la venta.  Desde ese momento comenzó a trabajar vendiendo encebollado.  El se encarga de la preparación, para posteriormente venderlo en su puesto en la calle.  Es casado y su esposa lo ayuda con los gastos del hogar ya que también trabaja.  Tiene hijos pero ya todos son mayores de edad.  A futuro desea tener su propio local para montar la picantería y con sus ingresos, terminar de construir su casa.  Ahora necesita el crédito para realizar unos arreglos en su casa.
texts.en:
The client is from the Guasmo area of Guayaquil.  He learned his trade at a young age and one day decided to work as a vendor. From that time, he started to work selling encebollado (fish stew made with vegetables). He is responsible for preparing it, so that he can later sell it at his street stand. 

He is married and his wife helps him with the household expenses, as she also works. He has children, but all are adults now. In the future he wishes to have his own shop, so that he can set up an eatery, and with his income finish building his house. Now he needs money to carry out repairs to his home.

loans.use: To pay for home repairs.

loans.name: Gene Agustin

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Tiene 20 años con este negocio de taller de madera, ya que su padre le enseñó desde muy pequeño y le gustó ya que ha resultado ser muy productivo.  Trabaja de lunes a viernes, desde temprano en la mañana.  No es casado y no tiene hijos por el momento.  A futuro le gustaría tener un almacén donde pueda exhibir sus artesanías en madera.  Por ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de madera, diluyente, pintura y herramientas.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Portoviejo.  He has had his woodworking shop for 20 years, as his father taught him from a young age.  He liked it and it has turned out to be very productive. 

He works from Monday to Friday from early in the morning. He is not married and has no children for the moment.  In the future he would like to have warehouse where he can display his wood crafts. For now he needs a loan to buy wood, paint thinner, paint and tools.

loans.use: To buy materials for his business.

loans.name: Marco Santiago

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Escogió esta actividad porque el padre le enseño desde muy pequeño el trabajo del comercio.  Trabaja solo todos los días, desde temprano.  Es casado y su esposa tiene un pequeño taller de costura.  Tiene 3 hijos, la mayor es casada y los otros tienen 18 y 11 años, y estudian en la escuela fiscal del sector.  Desea a futuro que su negocio crezca y ayudar a su esposa con su taller, además de mejorar su vivienda.  Ahora necesita el dinero del crédito para la compra de medias, bikinis, boxers y demás ropa para su comercialización.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Portoviejo.  He chose this line of work because his father taught him the retail trade at a very young age.  The borrower works alone every day, starting in the early morning hours.  He is married and his wife has a small sewing workshop.  They have three children.  The oldest one is married and the other two are ages 18 and 11 and attend a state school in the area.  In the future, he wants to grow his business and also help his wife with her workshop.  In addition, he wants to make improvements to their home.  

For now the borrower needs the money from this loan so that he can buy stockings, bikinis, boxers, and other types of clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy stockings, bikinis, boxers, and other types of clothing to sell.

loans.name: César Ramiro

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Empezó tiempo atrás trabajando con su papá y con el tiempo decidió independizarse.  Trabaja todos los días desde temprano, inclusive los fines de semana.  Es casado y su esposa es ama de casa.  Tiene 3 hijos, de 13, 11 años, quienes van al colegio y escuela fiscal de su barrio, y también uno pequeño, de 2 años.  A futuro, le gustaría arreglar su casa y levantar otro piso para que sus hijos tengan cuartos independientes.  Por ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de forros de colchón, controles y sábanas.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Portoviejo.  He started out some time ago working with his father, but eventually he decided to become independent.  The borrower works every day, including the weekends, and begins in the early morning hours.  He is married and his wife is a homemaker.  They have three children (ages 13, 11, and 2).  The two older children attend schools in their neighborhood.  

In the future, the borrower would like to remodel his house and add another floor so that his children can have rooms of their own.  For now he needs a loan so that he can buy mattress covers, remote controls, and bed sheets.

loans.use: to buy mattress covers, remote controls, and bed sheets.

loans.name: José Marcelino

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Empezó trabajando en un amigo y luego decidió trabajar solo y tener su propio negocio.  Trabaja de solo, de lunes a sábado.  Es casado y su esposa es ama de casa.  Tiene 3 hijos, de 15, 11 y 5 años, quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal de su sector.  A futuro, desea poner un local en su casa para que lo atienda su esposa y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.  Ahora, necesita el crédito para la compra de productos naturales, carcasas y controles.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Portoviejo.  He began working with a friend and later decided to work alone and start his own business.  The borrower works by himself Monday through Saturday.  He is married and his wife is a homemaker.  They have three children (ages 15, 11, and 5) who attend a state school in the area.  In the future, he wants to set up a shop in his house that his wife can manage while their children finish their studies and go on to become professionals.  

For now he needs a loan so that he can buy natural products, phone cases, and remote controls.

loans.use: to buy natural products, phone cases, and remote controls.

loans.name: Mary Asunción

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Empezó tiempo atrás con la venta de comida, luego de haber salido de su anterior trabajo.  Trabaja sola, todos los días.  Es casada y su esposo se dedica al negocio de la cerrajería.  Tiene 4 hijos, de 16, 7, 6, y 2 años, quienes estudian en la escuela y colegio fiscal del área donde residen.  Tiene la idea de tener un negocio grande a futuro, para no depender de ninguna persona.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de ollas, platos y otros artículos de hogar para su venta.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Portoviejo. She began selling food sometime ago, after having left her previous work. She works alone, every day. She is married, and her husband has a locksmith business. 

She has four children, ages 16, 7, 6, and 2 who go to school and high school in the area where they live. 

She has the idea of having a large business in the future so that she doesn't have to depend on anyone. Now she needs the loan to buy pots, plates and other household items to sell.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Lucrecia Concepción

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Empezó trabajando en un taller y decidió salir de ese trabajo por sus hijos, ya que necesitaban más cuidado.  Es ahí cuando monta el taller en su casa.  Trabaja sola, todos los días.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer para una empresa.  Tiene 3 hijos, de 15, 13 y 6 años, quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal de su barrio.  A futuro, desea que su taller sea muy conocido y poder mejorar sus casa también.  Por ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos y el mantenimiento de su máquina de coser.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Portoviejo.  She began working at another shop and decided to leave that job because her children needed more attention.  That is when she decided to establish a workshop in her house.  The borrower works alone every day.  She is married and her husband works as a chauffeur for a company.  They have three children (ages 15, 13, and 6) who attend a state school in their neighborhood.  

In the future, she wants her workshop to become well-known and to make improvements to her house.  For now, she is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, and to pay for the maintenance of her sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy materials and to pay for the maintenance of her sewing machine.

loans.name: Martha Consuelo

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Empezó con este negocio debido a que cuando llegó a vivir al que ahora es su domicilio, sus hijos estaban estudiando en la escuela y su esposo era agricultor, así que vio la necesidad de poner un negocio para ayudar al esposo.  Trabaja sola, todos los días, desde temprano en la mañana.  Es viuda y sus hijos están todos casados e independientes.  Desea poder ver, en un futuro, a todos sus hijos unidos y trabajando duro hasta su vejez.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar y otros abarrotes para su tienda.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Portoviejo.  She started with this business due to the fact that when she came to live in what is now her home, her children were going to school and her husband was a farmer; so she saw the need to set up a business to help her husband. 

She works alone, every day, from early in the morning. She is a widow and her children are all married and independent. In the future she wants to be able to see all her children close-knit and working hard until old age. Now she needs a loan to buy rice, sugar and other groceries for her store.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her store.

loans.name: Zholdoshbek

texts.en:
Zholdoshbek is a student at the American University of Central Asia, department of Business Administration. Below is his story:

“My name is Zholdoshbek. I graduated from Bishkek Kyrgyz-Turkish high school this year. Since seventh grade, I have excellent marks in all subjects and over the past five years my GPA at school was 5.0 and I am a holder of Diploma with Honors. In ninth and tenth grades I was a president of my class and made big changes in our extracurricular activities, one of which was gathering smart students together. The group was responsible for students with marks. We used to help those who had difficulties in their studies in order to advance their knowledge through organizing English language, math, chemistry, biology and computer courses. I was the one responsible for math and chemistry courses. As a consequence, our class became one of the best among four.
 
To take part in the development of my country is one of my dreams and I must take my place in the society to make it happen. I hope our generation will bring big changes to our country’s development. 

My family cannot afford to pay the tuition fee fully as we have five children in our famly, and my parents pay not only for my education, but also for my siblings. Therefore I would like to take an opportunity and apply for a Kica loan, which AUCA gives to all its students.”

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Nursultan

texts.en:
Nursultan graduated from secondary school this year and is a student of the American University of Central Asia, department of Business Administration. Here is his story:

"Studying at school, we gain knowledge and skills for future development. But there is a day when we finish school and stand at a crossroads, where every road is a path on which we will go into the future. It is known that everyone has their own aptitudes and wishes. Based on these, we choose our path. 

In the future, I want to be a specialist who can speak the language of business and administration. I am sure that education, training, and the ability to work, which I received at the Lyceum, can go on by learning the program of Business Administration at the American University of Central Asia.
 
The choice of this career, first of all, associates with a rapidly developing system and market relations in the daily life of our country and the world.
Whereas before, during the Soviet system, everything was decided by the state authorities in the form of state plans and five-year plans. Nowadays we are living in times of market economy and all ways are open for business. If you have the necessary knowledge, you can open your own business and develop it, or realize yourself in a variety of business firms, cooperation and government organizations.

In this regard, I chose a path – studying the laws of business and administration. For this, first of all, I consider it is necessary to get a quality education, and I’m sure at AUCA I can get it because in our country, only there that appropriate education is given. After learning that the business administration program at AUCA is the leading business program in our region, I definitely stopped my choice on it. In addition, the fact that many of AUCA graduates continue their education at the universities of the United States, Europe, and other major countries also affected me.

The school where I studied, I was tough to work, having explained to me a simple postulate, which states that the work is the result of my own efforts and leads to quality education. In 10th grade, I began to participate in the Olympiad on mathematics. But then I was advised by my teacher to take history. I won it twice and then I took second place in Republican Olympiad.
 
In the future, I would like to become a professional who is able to manage large business projects where new, innovative, and creative ideas and programs will be generated and implemented. 

Unfortunately, my parents cannot afford paying the tuition fees fully. But AUCA gives a very good opportunity to its students. All the students of AUCA have an opportunity to get Kiva loans to cover the tuition fees. So, I am applying for a Kiva loan, which will help cover the fees."

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is a student of the American University of Central Asia, department of International and Comparative Politics. Below is the story of Malika:

“My name is Malika. This year I have graduated from secondary school in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan and enrolled in the American University of Central Asia, department of International and Comparative Politics. That was my dream, and I am so happy to become a student of one of the prestigious universities of Central Asia that gives the best education to its students. I believe that I will be able to achieve my goals after graduating from AUCA. I am a diligent student and would like to work in international organizations after graduation.
 
I have played a very active role in the social life of my school and in general. Social activities really bring me pleasure. There were so many competitions that I took part of in my life. One of them was the Turkish Olympiad, which I aimed myself to win. I tried it every year from 7th to 10th grade and I won. The finalists were sent to Turkey, so I visited Turkey. Lots of school children were representing other countries too and I was so proud to represent my country.

It was an exciting trip, and I won bronze medal for my presentation. I wished I've won 1st though. But I am sure, I will be able to do so in the future. While in Turkey, I deeply felt how much I love my country, and I represented all the best things we have: our national dress, our hospitality, etc. 

Moreover, my presentation was about “Manas”, which I think was a great thing to share with others. All people wanted to take a picture with me and I was so excited about that. I also took an active part in many other extracurricular activities in my school. 

I believe that both my educational background and all the mentioned above will allow me to be one of the best students of AUCA. I will try to be one of top students.”

loans.use: to pay for higher education tuition.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa graduated from secondary school this year and enrolled in the American University of Central Asia, department of psychology. Raisa studied at a private school, “Ilim.”  Below is her story.

“My parents believe that the future of each person depends on the quality of the education. Therefore they did their best to give all opportunities to get a high quality secondary education. I studied at one of the best schools of Bishkek. I also have a brother, who enrolled at University in Moscow after graduation of secondary school. 

"Besides I strongly believe that each person has a duty to involve in social life. I am an active person and try to take part in all social events actively. I have a volunteering experience: there is a relief fund for orphans and older people in our secondary school. We organized volunteer groups and visited an orphanage, named 'Meerim bulagy.'  Our group picked up clothes, toys and bought food and presented them, but the most important thing that we came to share our love and care with them. We organized concert, sang songs, danced and played. In the end, children didn’t want to let us go. Besides, I visited a home for the elderly and sometimes brought them to school, where we organized a holiday for them. I also work in Resource Centre for the old people in Kyrgyzstan since February. 

"I hope both my educational background and my volunteering experience will help me to be one of the best students of AUCA. The American University of Central Asia has been the University of my dreams for years, and I will try to do all my best to be one of the best students. 

"Unfortunately, my parents cannot afford paying the tuition fees fully. Therefore I am applying for Kiva loan, which will give me an opportunity to cover my higher education.”

loans.use: To pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Dmitriy

texts.en:
Dmitriy is a student at the American University of Central Asia, department of business administration, and below is his story.

“Nowadays the role of education is very important in our life. There are many universities in our country, so the step of choosing a suitable one defines our future career and even the whole life. it is known that one of outstanding universities in Central Asia is AUCA because it provides high quality of education and a big variety of extracurricular activities. There are lots of required and well-paid professions nowadays and AUCA gives an opportunity for students to choose and study according to their interests. 

"A reason of my desire to study at AUCA is that I am fond of mathematics, economics and even international relations with other countries. Economics is one of the most important sciences, which helps to develop the world’s living conditions and relations among the people from different countries. I think it is amazing to forecast the future decrease or increase of economics situation, estimate all important object and sources and make correct decisions which will determine my future success. That’s very outstanding and useful knowledge which I can get at AUCA. 

"I have some achievements in education. I won second place in the English language in Republican Olympiad. At the same time I have a particular interest in mathematics and physics. Last year I won second places in regional Olympiads in math and physics.
