That is the reason Ana will use the loan to buy galvanized zinc sheeting.  This will allow her to have a house that is in a better state.

loans.use: to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Divinah

texts.en: Divinah is a 25-year-old married woman. She has one child who is 3 years old. She describes herself as a focused person who is ready to accept corrections. She operates a retail shop where she sells bread, sugar, milk and other goods. She describes her biggest challenge to be the lack of water storage facilities in her house. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility. She hopes that in the future she will expand and diversify her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has one child who is two years old. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows crops. 

She describes her family's challenge to be insufficient water. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy iron sheets and gutters. This will enable her family to harvest rain water for domestic use. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have a bigger family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 10,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy iron sheets and gutters to harvest rain water for domestic use

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be determined, calm and focused. She operates a salon where she offers salon services. She describes her family's challenge to be lack of enough water storage facilities. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy a water tank. This will enable her family to store enough clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business and keep her family safe and healthy. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 40 years old and comes from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has four children, ages 2 to 10. She has been engaged in fishing for a long time now, as a way of helping her husband.

She is asking for a loan to buy flashlight and hardwood for house renovations. She is determined to make sure that her children have a good education out of her income and a comfortable house for them to stay in.

She would like to continue her business, so she can provide well for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy flashlight and hardwood, for house repair

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
54-year-old Anecita is from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She earns a living through rice farming. She is married with three adult children and one dependent, age 12, and is dependent on her crops for income. 

Anecita barely earns an average income of 3,000 PHP per month. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. From this loan, she expects a good harvest and an increase in business profitability. 

The additional income will go to her family's daily consumption and possible new business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of KES 15,000 to purchase beans and maize for resale. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Louise M.

texts.en: Louise lives at Sinkor, in Montserrado County, where the capital city of Liberia is located. The area is well-known as the commercial center of Liberia. She is 36 years old and married, and she has two children. They are ages 6 and 8, and they are in school. From 2011 she has been running a shop where she sells charcoal, by the bag or at retail. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her. She likes her business, because it gives her more profits and makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal to sell at her business. She wants to save more money, to build her house.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business,

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a single mother of two born in her village called Kinyaga in Mbeere District.  She works as an organizing secretary for a single mothers group that is involved in taking care of orphaned children in the village.  She, in conjunction with the community health workers (CHWs), serves to see that the children in the community gain access to health advisory services.  The motorbike will boost her movement as well as that of the CHWs to better offer services to the children and community at large.  She will also be able to generate income through a taxi transport business which will support her young family.  "I strongly believe that with KIVA support, I will be able to support and save lives of children in my community," she says.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to support community health workers

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 30-year-old married man. He has one child who is one year old. He describes himself as respectful and humble. He operates a business for which he transports customers using his motorcycle. He describes his biggest family challenge as a lack of water storage facilities. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. In the future, he hopes to buy another motorcycle. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for domestic use

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in Logan Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is 54 years old, married and has seven children between the ages of 30 and 18. Four of her children are presently in school and living at home. She is a 5th grade dropout. 

For the past ten years she has been running a shop where she sells king-juice (an alcoholic drink made of sugar-king) by the gallon, rice by the bag, and other goods. She started this business with money from her husband, with this little money she managed to establish her business. She learned this way of selling from her friends. 

She is proud of her business because she makes a lot of profit and it keeps her busy. She is requesting a loan to buy king-juice, rice, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house and improve her living conditions even more.

loans.use: to buy king-juice and rice for her business.

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en:
Vahan is from Gyumri town. It has already been 10 years since Vahan started providing telephone services. Particularly he provides telephone connections abroad and gives locals an opportunity to talk with their relatives abroad.  As the emigration rate of Armenia is very high and almost every household here has a relative abroad, Vahan's service is in high demand. Due to his hard work over these 10 years, Vahan was able to form a client base that only uses his provided service. Now, this hardworking young man needs financial support to be able to make network improvements and pay for a new connection which has higher quality and speed. 
Vahan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.  This loan is very important for Vahan to be able to expand his business and provide better quality service to his customers.  Vahan lives together with his parents and brother and is the only breadwinner of the family.

loans.use: to pay for a new connection and network improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a lady of forty-one years, married to Dominic and a mother of four children. She is a tailor in Kiambu town and has been in this business for eleven years now. She gets a monthly income of twenty-eight thousand shillings.

This will be Grace's third loan with KADET LTD. She had repaid all the other loans successfully. She wants to use the money to buy clothing materials in bulk. 

In the future, she wants to be a prosperous business lady and also to fully provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing material.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Ana es una mujer humilde pero muy trabajadora quien vive únicamente junto a su hija de cinco años de edad por quien se esfuerza día con día para contar con todo lo necesario para tener una vida estable. Ana solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la construcción de una pila más grande y que tenga más capacidad de almacenamiento de agua, es por esto que ella invertirá el dinero para realizar la compra de materiales de construcción como: hierro, cemento, arena y ladrillos.
texts.en: Ana is a humble woman, but very hardworking. She lives with her 5-year-old daughter, for whom she works hard day after day to have everything she needs to have a stable life. Ana is asking for a loan from Fusai, through which she will be able to have the necessary money to invest in building a larger basin that has more water-storage capacity. This is why she will invest the money in construction materials like iron, cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.use: to build a large basin.

loans.name: Marthaline

texts.en:
Here is 21-year-old Marthaline; she lives in Logan Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is single and has two children ages 5 and 8. They are presently in school and live at home. She was unfortunate not to complete 12th grade. 

She started her business with a small amount of money given to her as credit from her uncle and she managed to turn it into a larger amount. She learned this business from other business women who sell in the local market. She likes her business because she makes a lot of profit and it provides cash for her expenses. She is proud of her business because it makes her popular. She described herself as a hard-working businesswoman. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more freezing chicken for her business. Her plan is to build a decent house for her children. She thanks the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more freezing chicken for her business.

loans.name: Vargola

texts.en: Vargola live at Sinkor in Montserrado County, which is well known as the main commercial city of Liberia.  She is 42 years old, married, with six children between the ages of 10 and 25.  For years now she has been running a table at the market where she sells rice, peppers, bitter balls, vita, and others items.  She started this business with help from her husband and learned this way of selling from him.  She likes her business because it gives her more profit and makes her popular.  She is requesting a loan to buy more peppers, bitter balls, rice, vita, and others items for her business.  She wants to get more money to build her house since she has a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more peppers, bitter balls, rice, vita, and others items for her business,

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en: Adeline is 25 years old. She is single and sells auto parts. She has spent 2 years in the business. With the loan, she would like to buy more auto parts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more spare auto parts for selling.

loans.name: Marie Solange

texts.en:
Marie Solange is 28 years old. She is married to a motorcyclist and they both have one child, age two. She has been selling sugar and soaps for the last five years and she is still in the same business. 

She wants a Kiva loan to upgrade her business by adding more hundred kilograms of sugar and soaps for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soaps for sale.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is 24 years old, he is married with one child, and he lives in Rutumbi village in Mbeere District.  Gerald has been an active community social worker since 2009.  He is involved in mentoring young boys and girls, demonstrating the advantages of good living in a drug-free environment by their own peer groups that raise funds through working for members of the community’s homes and farms.  Gerald also participates in health outreach field days organized by Youth Empowerment strategy groups targeting boys and girls in different locations.  “Having my own bike will make it possible for me to reach out to many families and other activities organized away from my village,” adds Gerald. “Knowing that the impact of this support will be felt by many community members also encourages me to concentrate on community work including support to community health work."

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to support community health work

loans.name: Mohamed Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a primary school located in Kassie, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. They have come to SMT, a local partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 12,500,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones). With the help of this loan, they are going to buy or invest in things that their mere salaries could not let them buy or invest in. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Mohamed is the featured leader of this team of teachers. Born in Mabonto, in northern Sierra Leone, Mohamed  is married to a teacher. The couple has five children who are attending primary, secondary and tertiary academic institutions. Mohamed has been a schoolteacher for 16 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school/college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school/college fees for his children.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. Amina dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a widowed woman with four children who are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mlongo has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past eight years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of high cost of purchasing fish, especially during cold currents in the deep sea. 

Mlongo is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil, and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 33 years old. She has been selling sugar and rice for the past ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice and sugar for sale. She plans to use the profits for making more savings.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and rice for sale.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business.

Her previous loan enabled her to save money from her food stall business. She is requesting for a loan of ksh. 20,000 to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice,and meat for her business.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and meat  for her business

loans.name: Monigo

texts.en: Monigo lives at Sinkor in Montserrado County, which is well known as the main commercial city of Liberia. Monigo is married to a local businessman. They have two children ages 5 and 11. Her two children are attending school and live at home with her. For the past 7 years now she has been running a table at the market where she sells rice, peppers, bitter balls, vita, etc. She started this business with help from her father and learned this way of selling from him.  She likes her business because it gives her more profits and makes her popular.  She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, peppers, bitter balls, vita, etc. for her business.  She wants to get more money to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, peppers, bitter balls, vita, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Annonciatte

texts.en: Annonciatte is 57 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been selling different types for the past five years. She wants the loan to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children. She wishes to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 62 years old from San Miguel, Bohol.

She is married with 8 grown children. Josefina has owned a Sari-sari store that caters to the needs of her neighborhood for 13 years now. She sells basic household items like seasoning, canned goods, noodles, eggs, toiletries, snack foods and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of canned goods, sugar, seasoning and toiletries. She is hoping that with the loan she will not lack stock of items needed by her customers. Her income will provide for her family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, sugar, seasoning and toiletries.

loans.name: Santos Dora

texts.es: Santos vive junto a su pequeña hija, por quien trabaja muy duro para salir adelante, Santos es madre soltera quien se dedica a la elaboración de pupusas (un plato típico en todo el país) para ganarse la vida. Ella solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, con el cual pueda invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: lámina, madera, cemento y arena, para realizar la construcción de un dormitorio en su casa de habitación y así también pagar la mano de obra. De esta manera Santos podrá ampliar un poco más su hogar.
texts.en: Santos lives together with her small daughter for whom she works very hard to get ahead.  Santos is a single mother who works making pupusas for a living (corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, pork rinds, chicken, or beans - a typical dish throughout the country). She is asking FUSAI for a loan which she will use to build a bedroom in her house.  She will use the money to buy construction materials such as: sheets of metal, wood, cement and sand, and also to pay for labor costs. In this way she will be able to expand her house a little bit more.

loans.use: to build a bedroom in her house.

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.en:
Hawa is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Hawa was born in Waterloo, a town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city, 34 years ago. She is married to a trader, and the couple has two children who are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. Hawa sells dishes, plastic buckets, bowls, coolers, plates, spoons, etc., and has been doing business for 18 years now.  

With the help of this loan, Hawa and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve on their living conditions. Hawa will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL, or Sierra Leone leones) to buy dishes, plastic buckets, bowls, coolers, plates, spoons, etc., to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy dishes, plastic buckets, bowls, coolers, plates, spoons, etc., to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Dishon

texts.en: Dishon is a father of 3. He hails from Kiruriri village, Mbeere District and has been involved in the community support program there.  He has been instrumental in moving around and repairing community water pumps and small generators that serve the various community health and maternal centres and the satellite health facilities in his area. Dshon is keen to see his community overcome health related challenges hence the volunteer maintenance work that he has been doing. He recently started a small make shift workshop to put his basic mechanics skills at work. He is keen to purchase a motorbike so that he can give adequate support to the health facilities that benefit his community.  With a motorbike, “I will be able to efficiently service the community health facilities as well as run my little shop and run a taxi business for a minimal fee as well as use it for family occasions."  With a motorbike, John and the group will be able to cover a bigger area as well as support and collaborate with the health workers who make weekly counseling sessions to the groups. John believes the motorbike will have an immense impact to both the group and him as it will boost income generation from taxi business using this boda boda.

loans.use: To purchase a motocycle to support community health work

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a family man of 3 children.  He was born in Mubuthu Village of Mbeere District. He has been working with the community as a community mobilizer in health, food security and environmental advocacy. He owns a public address system that he gives out to the community for use during the big community events or public campaigns such as community health field days.  However, he is faced with challenges when it comes to transportation from one venue to another.  With a motorbike, he sees himself becoming as flexible as possible and will be able to transport his equipment easily without inconveniences and also have more field days planned in a day.  This, as he puts it, will mean he will be able to reach more of his community families.

loans.use: To purchase a motocycle to do community health work

loans.name: José Demetrio

texts.es: José Demetrio se ha dedicado al campo duranto toda su vida. Fue al lado de su padre donde aprendió todo lo que sabe. Como el café es el principal producto de la región en la que vive se ha dedicado a producirlo desde hace más de 20 años. Para esta cosecha el solicita un crédito el cual utilizará para renovar parte de su finca y para comprar fertilizantes. Además de producir café José Demetrio cuenta con algunas vacas para producir leche y también tiene un terreno del cual extraen piedra la cual se utiliza en la construcción.
texts.en:
José Demetrio has been working as a farmer all his life. It was alongside his father that he learned everything he knows. 

Since coffee is the main product from the area where he lives he has been growing it for more than 20 years. He is asking for a loan to use for this crop in order to make improvements to part of his farm and to buy fertilizer.

In addition to growing coffee José Demetrio has some cows producing milk and also he has land from which stones are extracted which are used in construction.

loans.use: to make improvements to his farm and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married with four children; three in school and one underage. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanasha has operated fruits and vegetable stall business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial supports.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives at Sinkor in Montserrado county, the capital city of Liberia, which is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 42 years old and married to a teacher. They have six children between the ages of 16 and 19 who are in school and live at home. 

Over the past seven years now, she has been running a table market where she sells beans, pepper, gari (gari made of cassava), oil and others items. She started this business with help from her husband, and learned this way of selling from him. She like her business because it gives her more profits and makes her popular.

She is requesting a loan to buy more beans, peppers, gari, oils and others items for her business. 

She wants to get more money to build her house, since she has a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more beans, peppers, gari, oil and others items for her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a father of 2 from Kaithungu village in Mbeere District.  John has been working with the community, especially elderly people and vulnerable families, showing them how to manage their petty business for income generation to sustain themselves.  He has been helping them to form small groups that hold sessions on nutrition and good health.  John has also initiated freelance photography in one of the groups in the village.  They, in turn, go to take photos during community events to support the local community health worker to reach as many families as possible.  John says that the trend of youth engaging in alcohol and other drug abuse could be checked by even a minimal meaningful engagement.  John intends to rally the youth that are idle and engage them in meaningful time by forming Environmental Health Clubs dubbed "uzima kwa vijana"; meaning good health to the youth.  Once he purchases his motorbike, he will have “wings to fly” as he says.

loans.use: To purchase a mototcycle for supporting community health workers

loans.name: María Vilma

texts.es: María es una persona muy trabajadora y estable quien vive desde hace 30 años en el mismo lugar, vive junto a su compañero de vida quien le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. María solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar láminas y de este modo reparar el techo actual que se encuentra picado y en muy mal estado. Así mismo invertirá para la construcción de una pila grande con lavadero que le permita almacenar más agua.
texts.en: Maria is a very hardworking and stable person who has lived in the same place for 30 years. She lives with her partner, who helps her with household expenses. Maria is asking for a loan from Fusai, with which she will have the money she needs to buy metal sheeting. This way, she will repair the roof, which has holes and is in a bad state. At the same time she will invest in building a large basin with a sink, which will allow her to store more water.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Jhoseline Idalia

texts.es: Jhoseline es una joven madre quien vive únicamente junto a su pequeña hija de un año de edad, para ganarse la vida y contar con todo lo necesario ella trabaja como empleada doméstica. Debido a que con el paso del tiempo las láminas de su casa se han ido deteriorando y permitiendo que la lluvia penetre a su casa, Jhoseline solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para realizar la compra de láminas galvanizadas y de este modo realizar la reparación del techo de su casa. Con esto tanto Jhoseline como su hija podrán estar mucho más cómodas y sin inconvenientes durante las noches de lluvia.
texts.en: Jhoseline is a young mother who lives with her 1-year-old daughter. In order to make a living and have everything that she needs, she works as a domestic worker. Since with the passage of time, the metal sheeting on her house has gotten damaged and allowed water to come into the house, Jhoseline is asking for a loan from Fusai. With this loan, she will have the money she needs to buy galvanized metal sheeting and make repairs to the roof of her house. With this, Jhoseline as well as her daughter can be much more comfortable and not be bothered during the rainy nights.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel está casado y vive junto a su esposa y dos hijas. Él trabaja realizando mantenimientos técnicos para una empresa de alumbrado eléctrico. Miguel solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, con el cual cuente con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de láminas galvanizadas y de este modo poder cambiar el techo de su casa; también invertirá en cambiar el piso de su casa ya que el actual está totalmente deteriorado. Con esto Miguel y su familia contarán con una casa en mejor estado y más cómoda para habitar.
texts.en: Miguel is married and lives with his wife and two daughters. He works doing technical maintenance for an electric lighting company. Miguel is asking for a loan from Fusai. With the loan, he will have the money he needs to buy metal sheeting and this way, change out the roof of his house. He will also invest in changing out the floor of his house, since it is completely damaged. With this, Miguel and his family will have a house that is in better condition and more comfortable to live in.

loans.use: to change the floor of his house.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married with 2 children.  He was born in an isolate village of Karura, Mbeere District.  He is a volunteer community worker in the field of public health and hygiene.  He heads his village's water and sanitation committee.  John is involved in extensive travel during health related community awareness raising campaigns.  "With the support of Kiva, I will be able to extensively reach many families hence offer the crucial health support that they need.
I thank Kiva for this timely support," adds John.

loans.use: To purchase a motocycle to support community health workers

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 36 years old. She owns a boutique selling different items. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar and soaps for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soaps for sale.

loans.name: Nelson Darío

texts.es: Nelson, a sus 47 años de edad se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, un restaurante que adquirió hace aproximadamente 5 años cuando el dueño anterior lo puso en venta, está ubicado en una zona muy transitada por lo que ya es reconocido y tiene mucha clientela, además tiene contratos con diferentes negocios del sector; trabaja de Lunes a Sábado de 7:00 am a 5:00 pm. Además de su labor en el restaurante, Nelson también se dedica a laborar como entrenador deportivo y, con ambas actividades genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hijo, ya que es padre soltero y toda la carga económica recae sobre él. El cliente es un hombre activo, dinámico y pujante, tiene un espíritu emprendedor que lo ha llevado a lograr los objetivos que se propone y siempre va en busca de nuevas alternativas que le permitan seguir avanzando. Actualmente solicita el crédito como un apoyo para comprar sillas, mesas y utensilios de cocina, de esta forma ampliará su capacidad para atender a los clientes y prestarles un mejor servicio, además la preparación de los alimentos será más ágil y eficiente, permitiendo que sus comensales queden a gusto tanto con la calidad del producto como del servicio, abriéndose paso para el incremento de sus ventas e ingresos. Nelson sólo desea que seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, ampliarlo y lograr que siga siendo una actividad rentable y sostenible en el tiempo, de esta manera podrá dar un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
At 47 years old, Nelson runs his own business - a restaurant which he acquired about 5 years ago when the previous owner put it up for sale.  It is located in a busy area so it is well-known and has a lot of customers. It also has contracts with different businesses in the area. Nelson works Monday to Saturday from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Besides working in the restaurant, he also works as an athletic trainer. Between both activities he generates enough income to take care of his son, as he is a single dad and all of the responsibility is on his shoulders. 

The borrower is an active, dynamic, energetic man with an entrepreneurial spirit which has allowed him to achieve the goals he has set and to always be looking for new ways to continue to get ahead. He is asking for this loan now to support his business with the purchase of chairs, tables and kitchen utensils so that he can increase his capacity to take care of his customers and provide better service. Additionally, food preparation will be faster and more efficient, allowing his diners to be pleased with the quality of the food as well as the service. This will lead the way to increased sales and income.

Nelson only wants to continue strengthening and expanding his business, and ensure that it remains profitable and sustainable over time. In this way he will be able to provide a better sense of well-being and quality of life for his son.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Las Misioneras (The Missionaries) Group

texts.en:
The eight women in Las Misioneras (The missionaries) live in the area around the town of San Gabriel, Suchitepéquez, Guatemala.  They chose the name of their group because they have a mission to make their businesses bigger and more profitable with Namaste’s help.  Their businesses include, making tortillas, selling fruits and vegetables, selling other food, and selling used clothing.  They work hard, either at home or in the nearby city of Mazatenango, to support their families and keep their children in school.  It is for their children that they want their businesses to grow and prosper.  They all dream of their children getting an education and having a better life. It is because of this dream that they have eagerly entered the Namaste program that will provide them a business advisor and money management classes in addition to a loan.  
Maria Isabel (1st from left) is 43, married, and has a child going to school.  She has a 2nd grade education.  Her business is selling tortillas close to a famous chicken restaurant, a good location.  She gets up very early in the morning to make tortillas.  There is no roof over her cooking area and she has to work in the rain during the rainy season.  She hires a woman to help her so that she has enough tortillas to sell.  With her loan she will buy corn and wood in bulk to get a better price.  She will also buy 6 pieces of tin with which to make a roof and enclosure for her cooking area.  This is especially important now, as it is the wettest part of the rainy season.
Maria Isabel sells approximately 32,500 handmade tortillas a month, working 234 hours.  Her current profit is approximately USD 465. She plans to sell 6000 more tortillas per month when she has more corn and wood.  She then expects to have a profit of USD 538.  With this 16% increase in profit she will be able to keep her business growing and ensure that her child gets an education.

loans.use: to buy corn and wood in bulk, and tin to cover the work space where she makes tortillas

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a merchant from San Miguel, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business where she sells items like soft drinks, eggs, coffee, and canned goods. Juana is also a rice retailer. She usually buys rice from NFA (National Food Authority) which offers the most affordable price for her neighbors.

Juana is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as rice, dried goods, soft drinks, biscuits, coffee and sugar. She hopes for her business to continue and possibly expand and buy more items in bulk.

loans.use: to buy rice, dried goods, soft drinks, biscuits, coffee and sugar.

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en:
Tobias is a male, age 47, and married to Caroline whom they have together seven children, ages 21,18,15,12,10,8, and 5.

He pays tuition for his six school-going children and stays with one house helper .

Tobias has approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to complete his residential house because he dreams of family improvement. He promises to pay after getting his salary, the sale of his agricultural products, such as bananas and trees, and the sale of pigs.

Tobias, however, faces the challenges of high costs of tuition for his school-going children, and the seasonality of the agricultural products, which is an additional source of income.

loans.use: To complete his residential house.

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es: Rubén es productor de café orgánico desde hace muchos años. El es socio de la "Unión Regional" y es allí a donde entrega en su totalidad su producción para que sea procesada y exportada, razón por la cual él siempre se preocupa que su producto sea de la mejor calidad. Para esta cosecha solicita un crédito para realizar labores de limpieza en sus fincas y comprer fertilizante orgánico para las plantas que compró hace algunos meses. Además de producir café Rubén también produce limón para así tener un ingreso extra para su familia.
texts.en:
Rubén has produced organic coffee for many years.  He's a member of Unión Regional, where he delivers his entire crop to be processed and exported, which is why he's always concerned about having the best quality product.

Rubén's requesting a loan for this harvest to do weeding tasks on his farm and to buy organic fertilizer for the plants he bought a few months ago.

In addition to producing coffee, Rubén also produces limes, so he has an extra income for his family.

loans.use: to weed his farm and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Triunfando Juntas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TRIUNFANDO JUNTAS” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Angélica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de refrescos, venta de galletas, artesano de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Angélica es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de una amiga, sin embargo antes vendía dulces y tenía experiencias en venta.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la facilidad del crédito.
texts.en:
The “TRIUNFANDO JUNTAS” communal bank will start its new cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the Juan Pablo Center. It is made up of nine members and led by a board of directors where Angélica is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them are a neighborhood store, selling clothes, selling cosmetics, selling drinks, selling cookies, and artisanal shoemaking. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswoman, among them Angélica. She says that she joined three years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Right now, she has she has a business selling cosmetics. She learned about this business from a friend, but before she sold candies and has experience in sales.
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying cosmetics that she will acquire in the traditional fairs wholesale. Later she will sell them in her sales space and this work will allow her to generate resources to support her family, since she is in a common law marriage and has two children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the ease of payments.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en: Augustin is 51 years old. He owns a boutique, and he has been running this business for the past seven years. With the loan, he wants to buy more sugar, beans and rice for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the school fees of the children who attend school.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, beans and rice for resale.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo has been farming rice since he got married, for more than 30 years now. He is 52 years old living in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He has four children, and his youngest is 16 years old. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for his farm so that it will produce a better yield. He is motivated to work hard and be productive for his family's consumption and for the education of his children. Any additional income will be for reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is aged 32. He sells auto parts. He has been running the spare parts business for the past five years. With the loan, he would like to buy more spare parts for motorcars for sale. The profits from the business will be used to increase his savings for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is married and has five children, three in school and two adults. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For over twenty years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women, and curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the Kshs (Kenyan shillings) 15,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana lives at Sinkor in the capital city of Liberia, in Montserrado County. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. 

Christiana is 39 years old and single. She has a 3-year-old child who lives at home and attends school. Over the past five years now, she has been running a table market where she sells fresh fish. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from friends. She likes her business because she makes more profits. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more fresh fish for her business. She wants to get more money to build her house.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Rizalina is from Trinidad Bohol. She is 52 years old and married with seven children. She and her husband bake bread for delivery to different Sari-sari stores in their community. This has been their business for 20 years, while raising and sending their children to school. Rizalina works hard and would like to have a continuous production of bread to meet the demand. She is asking for a loan to buy gasoline needed for delivery and flour. Rizalina hopes to expand her bakery business someday.

loans.use: to buy flour, and gasoline needed for deliveries.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. Mwanasha dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Sol De Cultura Y Progreso Group

texts.es: Este es el  nuevo grupo “Sol De Cultura y Progreso” conformada por 05 socios  dedicados a distintas actividades de comercio. Nelly una de las socias se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, en sus tiempos libres a la  preparación y venta de tortas; obteniendo un ingreso extra para su hogar. Se siente feliz pues gracia a su perseverancia puede seguir brindándole una mejor calidad a su familia. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de abarrotes, bebidas,  golosinas y de esta manera surtir su bodega. El anhelo de Nelly es de  comprarse un carro, la cual le facilite transportar su mercadería de su bodega. Nelly es separada y tiene 04 hijos 03 de ellos aún dependientes. El nuevo grupo “Sol De Cultura y Progreso” agradecen la oportunidad y el apoyo brindado. Nelly es la segunda del lado derecho y viste casaca color morado.
texts.en: This is the new group "Sol De Cultura y Progreso", made up of five members who work in different businesses. Nelly, one of the members, works selling basic goods. In her free time, she makes and sells tortillas, earning an extra income for her home. She is happy, since thanks to her perseverance, she can keep providing better quality for her family. She is asking for the loan to buy groceries, soft drinks, and candies, and this way, supply her small store. Nelly's wish is to buy a car, which will help her to transport her merchandise to her store. Nelly is separated and has four children, three of whom are still dependent on her. The new group "Sol De Cultura y Progreso" is grateful for the opportunity and the support provided. Nelly is the second person on the right side, wearing a purple jacket.

loans.use: to buy groceries, soft drinks, and candies.

loans.name: Bettie

texts.en:
Bettie lives in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 40 years old and married with two children aged 15 and 18, who are in school and live at home. For the past six years she has been selling dry fish in the community market. She started this business with help from her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends eight hours each day on her business and she uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her table. She said about herself, "I am business minded, and like my business because it gives me more profit."

She is requesting a loan to buy more dry fish to expand her sales. She wants to get more money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more dry fish to expand her sales.

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en: Anastase is 23 years old. He sells different items in a boutique, and has spent eight years in this business. With the loan, he would like to buy more beans, sorghum and rice for sale. He expects to use the profits for renovating his house.

loans.use: to buy more beans, sorghum and rice for sale.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Amigas” está conformado por cinco mujeres que viven en una comunidad muy tranquila donde aún se conservan las tradiciones típicas de la región como su lengua materna, sus fiestas patronales, etc. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron por la gran amistad que existe entre ellas para ellas, su amistad es muy valiosa. 

Doña Felipa quien es la representante del grupo tiene 42 años de edad, está casada desde hace 25 años con el señor José Eduardo y juntos han formado una familia con tres hijos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Doña Felipa se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace ya 12 años. Platica que inició su actividad porque la invitaron a vender productos de belleza por catálogo; ofrecía sus productos de belleza con sus amigas, vecinas y familiares. La actividad le gustaba mucho porque tenía muchos clientes “Al principio no me gustaba porque no tenía confianza en las personas, pero con el tiempo he ganado muchas amistades, he seguido vendiendo porque también hay premios cuando se llega  a la meta”. Después de mucho tiempo Doña Felipa es ahora líder de un grupo de personas que también se dedican a vender productos de belleza por catalogo. Para Doña Felipa es muy cómoda esta actividad porque no requiere de mucho tiempo, puede ofrecer sus catálogos mientras al mismo tiempo está haciendo otras cosas incluso estar al pendiente de sus hijos. Las íntegrantes del grupo están muy contentas por la oportunidad de obtener un crédito fondeado por personas de distintos países porque será de gran ayuda para sus negocios. Doña Tomasa invertirá en una florería, Adelina en la cría de lechones, Alicia en su estética y Susana en la cría de borregos.
texts.en: The "Las Amigas" group is made up of five women who live in a very quiet community where the region's typical traditions are still preserved, such as their native language, and their patron saints' festivals, etc. They chose the name of the group because of the great friendship that exists between them. Their friendship is very valuable. Felipa, the group's representative, is 42. She has been married to Jose Eduardo for 25 years, and together they have three children, who are in school. Felipa has worked selling beauty products out of a catalogue for 12 years. She says that she started this activity because she was invited to sell catalogue beauty products. She offered her beauty products to her friends, neighbors, and relatives. She liked this a lot because she had a lot of customers. "At first, I did not like it, because I did not trust people, but over time, I have made many friends. I've kept selling because there are also prizes when one reaches a goal." After a long time, Felipa is now the leader of a group of people who also work selling beauty products out of a catalogue. For Felipa, this is a very comfortable job, because it does not require a lot of time. She can offer her catalogues while she does other things, like look after her children. The members of the group are very glad for the opportunity to get a loan funded by people from different countries, because it will be very helpful for their businesses. Tomasa will invest in a flower shop, Adelina in raising piglets, Alicia in her beauty shop, and Susana in raising sheep.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and cosmetics

location.town: San Nicolas Guadalupe, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Grupo S (Comercio) Group

texts.es:
El "Grupo S" es un grupo integrado por familares quienes trabajan muy a gusto de manera independiente, comentaron que no les gustaría tener a otros miembros en el grupo de préstamo porque consideran que es más fácil arreglar detalles entre ellos. Esta familia vive en una comunidad  muy tranquila donde las personas aún conservan sus tradiciones culturales. Ellos son dueños de un taller que lleva activo por más de 30 años. 

Don Marco Antonio tiene 44 años de edad, está casado con la señora Elvira y juntos han formado una familia con sus hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Él platica que anteriormente trabajaba en la cuidad de México pero como ya tenía experiencia en autos decidió iniciar su propio negocio y para perfeccionar su servicio estudio tres años. Tiene varios clientes que vienen desde muy lejos; sin embargo, se van muy contentos porque Don Marco Antonio se esfuerza para obtener buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. La única dificultad de Don Marco Antonio es la falta de un terreno para ampliar su taller mecánico y equiparlo  muy bien, y en donde se encuentra actualmente el taller, ya no le quieren vender mas terreno. La única meta de esta familia es poder aumentar sus ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida es por eso que están solicitando tanto Doña Elvira y Jesús un crédito para invertirlo en su taller mecánico y comprar aceites y refacciones para automóviles.
texts.en: "Grupo S" is a group made up of relatives who work very comfortably independently. They said that they do not like to have other members in the loan group, because they believe it is easier to arrange the details among themselves. This family lives in a very quiet community where people still preserve their cultural traditions. They are owners of a workshop that has been active for more than 30 years. Marco Antonio, 44, is married to Elvira and together they have created a family with their children, who are in school. He says that he previously worked in Mexico City, but since he already had experience with cars, he decided to start his own business and in order to perfect his service, he studied for three years. He has lots of customers that come from very far away. However, they are very happy, because Marco Antonio works hard to earn good profits to pay for household expenses and his children's education. Marco Antonio's only difficulty is the lack of land to expand his mechanic shop and equip it well. They don't want to sell him more land where it is currently located. This family's only goal is to be able to increase its profits to improve its quality of life. This is why they, as well as Elvira and Jesus, are asking for a loan to invest in their mechanic shop and to buy oil and repair parts for cars.

loans.use: to buy oil and replacement parts for cars

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos es un joven de 23 años de edad, casado y padre de un hijo de 4 años. Nació en una humilde familia campesina, donde aprendió todas las tareas agrícolas, gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de mora, maíz y tomate, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en la plaza de mercado de la región, de esta manera ha conseguido los recursos económicos necesarios para sostener a su familia y proveer el alimento diario. Su pujanza y empeño le han permitido salir adelante, aún sobrepasando las adversidades que se le presentan por diferentes factores externos que afectan sus cultivos directamente, en especial cuando hay temporada de invierno que le daña sus cultivos. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, entre otros), de esta forma podrá darle continuidad a su labor y podrá obtener una cosecha mucho más productiva, dando como resultado un incremento en sus ventas. Carlos sueña con seguir cultivando su tierra y generar buenos ingresos de esta actividad, pues anhela que su hijo tenga un mejor bienestar y salud y, así, poder disfrutar junto a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carlos, 23, is married and has a 4-year-old son. He was born to a humble family from the country, where he learned about agricultural labor. Thanks to this, today he has blackberry, corn, and tomato crops. The harvests are collected and sold in the market plaza in the region. This way, he has gotten the economic resources he needs to support his family and provide their daily bread. His strength and effort have allowed him to move forward, even overcoming the obstacles that come up due to different external factors that directly affect his crops, especially when there are winter seasons that damage his crops. Currently he is asking for the loan to purchase farming supplies wholesale (seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, among other things). This way, he will be able to continue his work and he will be able to get a much more productive harvest, getting an increase in sales as a result. Carlos dreams of continuing to cultivate his land and earn a good income from this activity. His wish is that his son have greater health and comfort. This way, he can enjoy a better quality of life along with his family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale farming supplies (seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticides, among other things)

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mesaid has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past year, selling to passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fish, especially during cold currents in the deep sea. 

Mesaid is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: 55-year-old Romeo is a resident of San Miguel, Bohol. He is married and has six children. Five are grown and the youngest is seven years old. Romeo operates a Sari-sari store where he sell basic household needs like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, seasoning, toiletries and rice. He is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, liquor, chips, toiletries, and seasoning. Romeo hopes that with additional capital, he can make a better profit from his business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, liquor, chips, toiletries, and seasoning.

loans.name: Oscar Joel

texts.es: Oscar, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres en el municipio de Intibucá. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura. Hace 12 años que tiene sus propios cultivos en la zona donde siembra y produce papa, maíz y frijoles para la venta y consumo. La producción de papa la vende en el mercado local. El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 lempiras y los utilizara para comprar insumos como fertilizantes, fungicidas  para el cultivo de papa y preparar la tierra para sembrar granos básicos. Su plan es invertir para darle buena asistencia al cultivo y sacar mejor producción y obtener ganancias.
texts.en: Oscar, 23, is single and lives with his parents in the municipality of Intibuca. He has always worked in agriculture. For 12 years, he has had his own crops in the zone where he plants and produces potatoes, corn, and beans to sell and to eat. He sells his potato harvest in the local market. The loan he is asking for is for 15,000 lempiras and he will use them to buy supplies like fertilizers and fungicides for the potato crop, and to prepare land to plant basic grains. His plan is to invest to give good care to his crops and to get better production and earn profits.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fertilizers and fungicides for the potato crop, and to prepare land to plant corn and beans

loans.name: Ruth G.

texts.en:
Ruth  lives in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia,  well known as the commercial center of the country.  She is thirty-four years old and completed the ninth grade. Ruth is married with three children aged from two months to eighteen years. The children live at home and only two are in school. 

For the past five years, Ruth has been selling charcoal in the community market. She started this business with help from her husband and learned this way of selling from him. She spends eight hours each day on her business and she uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her table. She said, "I am a business-minded person and like my business because it gives me more profit."  

She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal to increase her sales. Ruth wants to get more money to educate her children and build a house. She thanks Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to increase her sales

loans.name: Reah

texts.en:
Reah lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. She has 4 children and has been doing this work for 20 years. Her primary income sources are tea and crops.

She stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is harvesting.  Her biggest challenge is tea picking.  Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Matondo.'

Reah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "They work closely with farmers."  This client was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session and she replied, "Savings culture."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Reah replied, "Their living standard will be raised."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Reah owns a cow, but does not own a pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower does not have a mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Mtama

texts.en:
Mtama is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and improved her living standards thanks to her hard work.  She still operates the cafe business and prepares food for her customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, maize flour, and sugar that will help her to invest back into her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, maize flour and sugar that will help her to invest back into her business

loans.name: Alberto Augusto

texts.pt:
O sr Alberto  é pai de um filho de 4 anos de idade.  ele trabalha  nos caminhos de ferro de mocambique.Para aumentar as suas receitas construiu uma loja de venda de  material de canalizacao no mercado perto de sua casa.
 Com o emprestimo pretende comprar material de canalizacao diverso  como tubos, colas , unioes para revender.
O seu maior sonho é se tornar um negociante de reconhecimento nacional, gostaria tambem de aumentar o tamanho de sua casa.
 Seu maior desafio é pagar o empréstimo com rapidez de forma a solicitar outro.
texts.en:
Alberto is the father of a 4-year-old son. He works for Mozambique Ports and Railways. In order to increase his income, he set up a store that sells piping supplies in the market near his house.
With this loan he intends to purchase a variety of piping supplies such as tubes, adhesive and couplings for re-selling.
His biggest dream is to become a nationally acknowledged retailer. He would also like to enlarge his house.
His biggest challenge is repaying the loan promptly so that he can request another one.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise so he can increase turnover in his store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 64 years old from San Miguel, Bohol. She earns a living through her food vending business, selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her place like banana cue (deep fried banana in caramelized sugar) and pancakes. She also sell prepaid electronic loads to mobile users. Rosita is applying for a loan to buy additional ingredients like sugar, bananas, flour and load wallet reload. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more for more income.  In the future, Rosita hopes to continue to improve her services to make her business more successful.

loans.use: to buy sugar, bananas, flour and load wallet reload

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en:
Dativa is 41 years old. She is a mother of two between the ages of one and eleven. 

She has been selling retail items for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more rice and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is an area that does not suffer from a dry season. He has three children. George has been doing agricultural work for five years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming as the "returns gotten from farming." His biggest challenge is "less time." One animal on the farm has been given the name Bogeka.

George was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan. He responded that it was due to the low interest rate. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. He replied, "It has come to help us."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, George replied it would "'stablize [his] family."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. George owns the following at least one cow and poultry but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net and electricity in the household, but does not have solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV or DVD.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 32 years old. She is from the municipality of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with two children ages two and nine.  

For ten  years, Juanita has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store where she sell snacks, candies, bread, detergent, canned goods and soft drinks. She barely earns an average income of 3,000 PHP that helps sustain her family’s basic needs. 

Juanita is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy rice, chips, detergent, shampoo and canned goods. She hopes that in the future she can continue to improve and expand her business for increased profits.

loans.use: to buy rice, chips, detergent, shampoo and canned goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn lives in Sinkor in Montserrado County where living conditions are almost like the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as a place in Liberia. She is 41 years old, married and has a 15-year-old child. Her child is in school and lives at home. Since 2011, she has been selling red oil, rice, coal, etc. in the community market. She learned this way of selling from her mother and started this business with help from her husband. She sells for as long as nine hours per day at her business, and she uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her table. She likes her business because it makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to buy more red oil, rice, coal, etc. to expand her sales. She wants to get more money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more red oil, rice, coal, etc. to expand her sales.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel is 26 years old from the community of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with two young children. Liezel’s desire is to help her husband in their fishing business. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, weight leads and to pay for the repair of their fishing boat. Liezel would like to make sure that she can make her business more profitable. Her income will assure her that her children are well provided for and have a healthy diet.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, weight leads and to pay for fishing boat repair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: with the construction of a dairy unit.

loans.name: Mark Jason

texts.en: Mark Jason is a 31-year-old man from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with a seven year old daughter. He is asking for a loan to invest in his habal-habal (motorcycle for passengers) business. He will use it to buy a spare tire, chain and motor oil. It will assure him of continued business once this additional capital is available. He hopes to expand his business and increase business profitability for his child's needs in school.

loans.use: to buy a spare tire, chain and motor oil

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en: Romelyn is 27 years old and is from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with three children aged 3, 4 and 6. Romelyn is engaged in the retailing of purified water to the people around her home. This is the main source of her income. Romelyn  is asking for a loan to pay for water to resell. She hopes her business will be a success and is saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to pay for water needs and consumption

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina is a native of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is 62 years old and is engaged in a sari-sari (general) store business. She sells basic household items like seasonings, canned goods, noodles, eggs, toiletries, snack food and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock of canned sardines, cooking oil and soft drinks. She is hoping that with the loan she will not run out of stock that sells on a daily basis. Her income will be for her healthy diet.

loans.use: to buy canned sardines, cooking oil and soft drinks.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. She has three children and has been doing this work for five years. Her primary income sources are from selling milk, eggs, tea and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Profits!' Her biggest challenge is 'Poor weather.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyangera.'

Evelyne was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'it has affordable rates.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Gives loans.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Evelyne replied 'it will bring in more income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Evelyne owns the following: 'cow, poultry, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, TV' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Teodola

texts.en:
Teodula is 51 years old and the mother of 3 children, her eldest is 27 and the youngest is 18. Her family lives in San Miguel, Bohol. She is used to farming since having her family, this has been their source of livelihood. 

Like most mothers, Teodula wanted her children to have a life that offers a brighter future. She realized that she could do better with her farming if given financial assistance, so she requested a loan to be used for buying seedlings and fertilizers. The extra income that she can get from her business will be used for her family’s daily consumption and her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Mumah

texts.en: Mumah lives in New Kru town; she is 46 years old, single with 2 children aged 22 and 29, both of whom are in college and only one is living at home. For the past four years she has been operating a small shop where she sells soft drinks. She says sometimes business is slow. She started this business by selling in the communities with the few goods she could afford, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business, and her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 44-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children aged between 13 and 21. She sell home-cooked snacks like banana cue (deep fried banana in caramelized sugar) and sweetened steamed cassava and cassava cake. Her husband works as a carpenter. With her help, they are able to provide for their children. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP in order to buy more ingredients including cassava, sugar and coconut. In the future, Aida would like to expand her business, to provide her family with good food and to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy coconut, cassava and sugar

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en: This is 42 year old Ophelia from Liberia; precisely, she lives in New Kru Town of Montserrado County. This community is one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is married and her husband is a local businessman, they have four children between the ages of 22 and 27. Three of her children are presently in college and living on their own. She stopped her education at grade 10. For the past 20 years she has been involved with business, and presently she is selling fish. She started this business by selling on a table market and later received money from her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends. She makes more profit and most interestingly she meets new people every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. Her plan is to build her house. She appreciates BRAC Liberia and the lenders who support small business people.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa lives and works in New Kru Town, which is home to the oldest market in Liberia. It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. Hawa is 38 years old, single with 4 children aged between 12 to 17, who are in school and live at home. 

For the past three years Hawa has been operating a small table market where she sells bed sheets. She started this business by selling dried fish around in her community with what little goods she could afford, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bed sheets for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more bed sheets for her business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. He has four children and has been doing this work for 20 years. His primary income sources are from selling milk, eggs, tea and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Cattle rearing.' His biggest challenge is 'Tea picking.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Maridadi.'

Richard was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Juhudi Kilimo finances farmers and I got so interested in their products.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Proper loan repayment.'

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Richard replied 'Their needs will be taken care of.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Richard owns the following: 'cow, pig' but does not own 'poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, TV' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Abigaie

texts.en:
Abigaie lives in New Kru town which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. The living conditions there are a bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, fewer bathrooms, filthy conditions, over populated, but most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper, there are transport options, some of the biggest markets in Liberia, and cheaper food.    
Abigaie is married, and her husband works as a steel bender. They have two children aged 8 and 13 who are currently attending school and living at home. Abigaie did not attend school; before starting her business she was involved with sales of cosmetics in the local market. With the loan proceeds she will buy more cosmetics to sell. She said "beside fewer goods on my table market, I have no other problems for now". With a little money from her mother she managed to establish this business, and learned by seeing other businesswomen five years ago. She enjoys the flow of customers. Her dream is to move from table to shop business.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, who is 43 years old, lives in New Kru town. She is married and her husband is a local businessman. They have three children whose ages are between 1 and 17. Among her three children, only two are attending school and they all live at home. 

Over the past six years, Evelyn has been operating a shop where she sells salt, sugar, coal, etc.  She says that the rainy season is her major challenge. She started this business by selling for her mother and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more salt, sugar, coal, etc. for her business. In the future, she plans to open a shop and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, sugar, coal, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jebbeh

texts.en:
Jebbeh is 50 years old and lives in New Kru, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is married and has three children between 22 and 38 years old. Jebbeh did not attend school. 

For the past seven years, Jebbeh has been running a shop where she sells cold water. She started this business by selling for her aunt, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She is very happy with her business because she earns good profits and it keeps her busy. She is also learning various local languages, which she enjoys. She is requesting a loan to buy more cold water to increase her business. Her future plans are to build another shop and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more cold water to increase her business.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular region for growing bananas. He has four children and has been doing this work for years.  His primary income source comes from tea and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming is earning the returns from farming. His biggest challenge is cattle rearing. Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Nyansanako."

Kennedy was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "The loan requirements are favorable."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. Kennedy replied, "The products are financed by Juhudi."

His highest monthly expenses are his children's school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Kennedy replied, "Their basic needs will be taken care of."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Kennedy owns a cow but does not own a pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, electricity, TV and DVD but does not have solar power, running water or a sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Biloa

texts.fr: Biloa est une femme de 46 ans celibataire, mère de 2 enfants de 12 et 22 ans qui vont à l'école.
