texts.en:
Aida is from the village Hayanist, of the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, daughter, son, and elderly, pensioner father. Her husband is a car mechanic. 

Aida is engaged in breeding livestock of hens and turkeys. She is also cultivating tomatoes and apricots. The family gets a little income from farming, which is not enough to cover their daily costs. This is why Aida wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit. She particularly wants to build a greenhouse, where she can cultivate plants. 

A loan of USD 1,000 will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family and will enable them to build a greenhouse. 

Since this is Aida’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. 

The family will be very thankful to the lenders for the goodwill in helping them to collect the needed loan.

loans.use: to pay for building a greenhouse.

loans.name: New York Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “New York” group from Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. They are petty-businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their respective businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

The featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Yayeh. Yayeh was born in Portloko 46 years ago. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a trader, and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Yayeh has been selling dried fish for seven years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy baskets of dried fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy baskets of dried fish to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg is 43 years old and lives with her mother in Kherlen, the easternmost province of Mongolia. She has been teaching meditation to local people for four years. Her mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some renovation. So she is requesting a loan of 5000000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, planks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, she will be able to renovate her old house. As winter comes near, it is necessary for her to renovate her house. Also, a renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating thus releasing fewer pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 49-year-old married woman residing in the town of Lahore, Pakistan. 
She has a husband, two daughters and two sons. 
Her husband runs a shop in which he provides scarf dyeing services to his customers. He is very expert in his profession and people like his dyed cloth. He dyes cloth under boiled water with the mixture of colors. Parveen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy gas cylinders and dye powder of various colors for his business.
Parveen hopes that this loan will help her husband's business by increasing their income and savings as well.
Parveen is very thankful to the Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders and dyeing powder of various colors for dyeing cloth.

loans.name: Aron Olivo

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Empezó con esta actividad tiempo atrás, cuando su tía lo apoyó con el negocio de venta de productos de plástico, con el cual hasta la fecha le ha ido muy bien.  Ha logrado incrementar su capital, con el cual le ha podido ayudar a su mamá.  Trabaja con su esposo, todos los días desde las 8 am hasta las 7 pm.  Se encuentra en estado de unión libre y su esposa le ayuda con sus labores, a pesar de que está embarazada.  Va a tener una niña dentro de poco.  Desea a futuro terminar de construir su casa y que su hija nazca con buena salud.  Ahora requiere el dinero del crédito para la compra de artículos plásticos y una vitrina para su negocio.
texts.en: The client is from the city of Quevedo.  He started this activity some time ago when his aunt helped him start his business selling plastic ware; to date he’s done very well.  He’s managed to increase capital that he’s used to help his mother.  He works with his wife every day from 8am until 7pm.  He’s in a common law relationship and his wife helps him with his tasks even though she’s pregnant.  She’s going to have a little girl shortly.  He hopes in future to finish building his house and that his daughter is born in good health.  He needs the loan money now to buy plastic ware and a display case for his business.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Zimbabwe Group

texts.en:
Zubeda is in her early 40s, married with four children who are still going to school.  She has been selling clothes since 2007.  She works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Zubeda's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania and she wants to use it to increase the stock of her clothes business. She dreams of managing electronic money transfers and also building her own house.

Zubeda will share this loan with the her Zimbabwe Group which has five members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the stock of her clothes business.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 35 years old, married and is blessed with four children, ages 4 to 10. Abraham is a livestock trader in Kapchelal and has been in business for eight years, earning an income of KES 12,000 monthly.

With his sixth loan of KES 105,000 from KADET LTD he intends to purchase more livestock for trading. The profits he gets will be used to repay the loan and also take care of his family's welfare.

His dream is to be successful both in business and life.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 55 years old and married to Jacob. They are blessed with four children, all of whom are adults. 

Mary, with her spouse, works on their family farm to ensure that they get enough farm produce, that is milk and other produce, to sell for profit to the nearby markets. They have been in the farming business for over a period of four years, earning an income of KES 8,000.

With her third loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), in the amount of KES 111,000, Mary intends to purchase fertilizer and seeds and to till more land.

The profits Mary earns will be used to educate her children who are in college. Her dream is to grow and be established in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds and to till more land.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Ashraf is 21 years old and lives at a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his four siblings and his parents. Ashraf is studying for a bachelor's degree in private education. He also does his own freelance work. He is planning to get his degree to work in his study field after graduation to start helping his parents financially. But his parents are currently facing a financial crisis which prevents them from paying his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Bélgica Nereira

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Cuando se hizo de compromismo, empezó a vender mercadería y poco a poco ha aumentado su negocio.  Trabaja sola, todos los días, desde las 9 am hasta la hora que vea conveniente.  Al momento se encuentra soltera y sus hijos están todos casados ya.  Desea en un futuro cercano, poder adquirir un vehículo y también contar con buena salud para seguir trabajando.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de una vitrina, ropa y sandalias para su comercialización.
texts.en: This client is from the city of Quevedo.  When she became engaged she started to sell merchandise and business has gradually increased.  She works alone every day starting at 9am and ending at whatever time is convenient.  At the moment, she’s single and her children are all married now.  She hopes in the near future to be able to acquire a vehicle and also to be in good health to continue working.  She needs the loan now to buy a display case, clothes and sandals to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 54 años de edad, es casado y tiene 6 hijas, 5 de ellas independientes y con familia aparte. En casa vive con su esposa y la menor de sus hijas con 21 años de edad, también viven dos nietos, todos depende económicamente de Jose. Su esposa se encarga de los oficios del hogar y por las tardes con su hija tejen hamacas.

No pudo estudiar, se caso a ala edad de 20 años, ya mayo asistió durante tres meses a una escuela nocturna y aprendió a leer. Desde hace 21 años trabaja tejiendo hamacas, aprendió con su padre que se dedicaba a lo mismo, también aprendió de ellos a trabajar la tierra.

Actualmente José solo siembra Maíz y Frijol, vende sus hamacas los días jueves y domingo en la ciudad, le toma 45 minutos para llegar al lugar, tiene que caminar durante 30 minutos hasta el municipio, luego toma el autobús que lo lleva a la ciudad.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una caja de hilo de seda con un costo de 460 dólares y el resto para la siembra establecida. Con ello asegura la fabricación de hamacas que es una buena fuente alterna de ingresos para la familia.

José desea reparar su casa, para vivir en mejores condiciones y comodidades, pues esta construida de bahareque y se deteriora con cada época lluviosa.
texts.en:
José is 53 years old and has six children. Five of them are independent and live separately with their families. José lives with his wife, his youngest daughter who is 21 years old. and two grandchildren. All of them are economically dependent on José. His wife does the housework and in the afternoon she weaves hammocks alongside her daughter.

José did not study. He got married at the age of 20.  He took night classes for 3 months to learn how to read. For the past 21 years he has woven hammocks, a trade he learned from his father who also practiced this trade. He also learned how to work the land from his parents. Right now José only plants corn and beans. He sells his hammocks on Thursday and Sunday in the city. It takes him 45 minutes to get there. He walks for 30 minutes into the municipality to catch a bus which takes him to the city. 

José will use the loan to buy a case of silk thread for $460 and the rest will go for his crops. He will ensure the production of the hammocks which is a good alternative resource for the family. José would like to repair his house to live more comfortably and in better conditions. His house is constructed of wattle and daub and deteriorates in the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy a case of silk thread.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is one of the most successful Zoona mobile money transfer business owners. She is a hardworking mother of one and has been operating her business for three years. Her first shop opened in 2010 and since has expanded to four shops in Kitwe. Kitwe is the second largest city in Zambia and is the mining center of the Copperbelt province.  

Sandra received her first Kiva loan in early 2012 and her second in May of 2013.  The loans helped grow her business by opening additional outlets and having adequate working capital float to service customers efficiently. She also enrolled herself at one of the largest universities in Zambia, where she is studying business finance.  

Now that Sandra has successfully paid back both her loans, she is requesting a third loan to open a new shop in Luanshya, a mining town located 51km away from Kitwe. The loan will be used to purchase a trading booth and use the rest as working capital float for the new shop. Sandra explains how having sufficient working capital is important to a successful new shop opening so you do not have to turn away customers. Having the shop start well is needed to maintain a good reputation within the community and grow.

Sandra wanted to let Kiva lenders know that she is grateful for their support. Now, she is able to take better care of her family and grow her business. She encourages lenders to continue to believe in supporting small business entrepreneurs like her.

loans.use: To open a new shop in a mining town called Luanshya, so that she can continue growing her Zoona mobile money transfer business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 35 years old, married and has two children, ages 7 and 2. He is a dealer of agricultural produce like rice and maize and has been in the business since 2007. He also sells local brew. He pays school fees for his older child and also one other dependent.

Moses has approached Ugafode for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy more produce, especially maize, now that the season is on. He will repay the loan using the proceeds from the sale of the produce.

Moses' dream is to buy a vehicle for easy transportation of the produce which will also reduce his costs. He also will be able to educate his children so that they have a bright future. However, he faces challenges like competition, seasonality and weather.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce (maize)

loans.name: Bethlehem Group

texts.en:
Avelina, who is in her early 40s, is a widow with two girls who are in school. 

For nine months now, Avelina has been managing her family's costs by running two businesses. One is a shop business where she sells soft drinks only and another is a restaurant. She is doing great in both businesses. Avelina works from 6am to 10pm daily and she is able to make good returns each month.

This is Avelina's first loan request with Tujijenge Tanzania, which will be used to improve her soft drinks shop and to stock more drinks to sell. 

She dreams that, one day, she will be able to build a house. She will share this loan with her loan group, Bethlehem Group, which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to improve her soft drinks shop and to stock more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Chinbat

texts.en: Mrs. Chinbat, 49 years old, lives with her family in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a conversion machinist at an enrichment facility for 21 years. Her elder son is a weaver and works at a carpet factory. She is requesting a loan of 7,700,000 MNT to buy an automobile that runs on electricity. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it produces no harmful pollution from the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. The car will be driven by her younger son who is unemployed and wants to render taxi service using the car.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora María Elena, trabaja como vendedora en una tienda de ropa ubicada en uno de los mercados de la capital de Managua. María Elena habita en un barrio muy vulnerable por la delincuencia, con mucho esfuerzo y gracias a los créditos que KIVA ha concedido ha mejorado algunas secciones de su casa de habitación. En esta ocasión esta solicitando un nuevo crédito para construir el muro perimetral de la parte oeste de su vivienda, que como se observa en la foto esta hecho de laminas de zinc, las cuales están en malas condiciones, representando mayor inseguridad y amenaza de accidente ante algún evento de la naturaleza. Con el préstamo comprará los materiales para la construcción de un muro fuerte como bloque, cemento, arena y hierro.
texts.en:
María Elena works as a saleswoman in a clothing store located in one of the capital city of Managua’s markets.  María Elena lives in a neighborhood that’s very vulnerable due to violence.  With much effort and thanks to the loans she’s gotten from Kiva she’s been making improvements to some sections of her house.  

On this occasion, she’s asking for a new loan to erect a perimeter wall along the west part of her house which, as can be seen in the photo, is made out of metal sheets which are in bad condition which means more insecurity and potential accidents due to weather factors.  She will use the loan to buy supplies like concrete block, cement, sand and iron rods to build a stronger wall.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Zachary is 49 years old, married to Teresia, and they are supporting two children.

He has a quarry business in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has operated for 13 years. Zachary has now ventured also into farming and has applied for a second loan from Kadet Ltd after paying his previous loan on time to enable him to buy fertilizer, spraying chemicals, and seeds. With anticipated profits, he plans to boost his farming business.

He hopes to improve his family's living standards in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, spraying chemicals, and seeds.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, is 42 years old and from Ndunyu Njeru, and she is married to Robert with three children who are in school.

She has been in the farming business for thirteen years, and has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her buy fertilizer for her farm, pay for labor, and  pay school fees. With the anticipated profits, she plans to boost her farming business.

She hopes to expand her farming so as to improve her family living standards in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pay for labor, and pay for school fees

loans.name: Gift Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 53-year-old Alice from Mutare. Alice is a member of Gift Group. She is widowed with four children, and three are attending school.  Her business of selling traditional herbs has been in operation for 11 years. She says the main challenges faced are high transport cost and the stiff competition that arises. Alice has requested a loan to purchase traditional herbs from Harare (Zimbabwe's capital) to supply to various people in and around Mutare. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's general welfare. In the future, Alice plans to own a herbal shop.

loans.use: to buy traditional herbs from Harare to supply to the town of Mutare.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en:
Massa lives in Long Town, she is 49 year old, and she is 6th grade dropout. From 2001 she has been running a table business in her community which sells fish. She started this business with a little amount from her husband's earnings. Massa is married and has 2 children ages 9 and 12 who live at home and attend school. She hopes to own a house for her children.

Massa is requesting a loan to buy more fish for her business. She sells from Monday to Saturday spending ten hours each day at her work.  She thanks BRAC Liberia for their support.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Nini Johanna

texts.es: Nini de 21 años de edad, es una joven mujer que habita con su cónyuge al sur occidente de la ciudad, donde tiene una pequeña tienda de ranchos, víveres, abarrotes, refrescos, la cual hace 4 años recibió de sus padres, para que Nini asumiera su control. Poco a poco le ha ido invirtiendo a este negocio, porque desde muy pequeña aprendió con sus padres, como hacerla crecer. En la actualidad vende de contado de lunes a domingos, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, comprando en el centro de la ciudad a distribuidores, que le ofrecen competitivos precios. Sus principales clientes son los vecinos y moradores de los barrios de su alrededor. Su meta más adelante es tener un espacio más amplio para atender con mayor excelencia a su clientela, y continuar con una carrera profesional, para finalizar con las adecuaciones a su vivienda. Nini dice “hay obstáculos pero no imposibles de pasar y más si el negocio se encuentra en una vía principal”. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  arroz por volumen, aceite en pimpina, refrescos y cárnicos entre otros productos de la canasta familiar, que rotan muy rápidamente y por eso debe tener una respuesta rápida para su clientela, haciendo de esta manera que su credikiva sea todo un éxito.
texts.en:
Nini, 21, is a young woman living with her spouse in the southwest part of the city where she has a small store she got from her parents four years ago for her to manage that sells snacks, foodstuffs, groceries and soft-drinks.  She’s gradually been investing in the business because she learned from her parents while still very young how to make it grow.

Her sales from 7 in the morning until 9 at night are cash based.  She makes her purchases from suppliers downtown that offer competitive prices.  Her main customers are neighbors and people who live around her.  Her goal for later on is to have a roomier space to provide more excellent customer service and to continue with a professional career to complete making home improvements.

Nini says: “There are obstacles but they aren’t impossible to overcome especially if the business is located on the main street.”  She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy rice in quantity, oil by the five-gallon container, soft-drinks and meat products, among other basic staples that rotate quickly and must be readily on-hand for her customers thus making her Kiva loan successful.

loans.use: to buy basic staples to stock her store.

loans.name: Lili Elivira

texts.es: Doña Lili, es una mujer soltera, bajo su responsabilidad se encuentra su mamá que es una señora mayor de edad. Desde hace mucho Lili se dedica a la venta de ropa desde su casa de habitación, donde maneja una tiendita. Doña Lili se ha caracterizado por ofrecer variedad de estilos a sus clientes por lo que solicita este crédito para comprar ropa de variedad como pantalones, camisas para  damas, caballeros y niños y de esta manera abastecerse de mercaderías a bajo costo, que permita aprovechar las ventas de estos últimos meses que restan del año, los cuales son buenos para el comercio.
texts.en: Lili’s single but her elderly mother is in her care.  Lili has sold clothes at home for a long time, she has a small store there.  Lili has been noted for offering her customers a variety of styles and is asking for this loan to buy various clothes like pants and shirts for women, men and children to stock up on low-cost merchandise to take advantage of sales during the last few months of the year which are good for commerce.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Alba Irene

texts.es: Alba, a sus 31 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 5 años. En los últimos 6 años ha trabajado en diferentes almacenes desempeñándose como vendedora de mostrador. Actualmente trabaja en un almacén de variedades como administradora del establecimiento, pero su deseo es comprar este negocio, por lo que hizo la negociación con el dueño para que se lo venda; es por esta razón que está solicitando el crédito, pues la totalidad del dinero será invertida en el pago del almacén para pasar de ser empleada a propietaria, pues su deseo es generar mejores ingresos para continuar solventando las necesidades de su familia, ya que ella es quien lleva toda la carga económica por ser madre cabeza de hogar. La cliente se caracteriza por su empuje, entusiasmo y perseverancia, lo que le ha permitido salir adelante sola, motivada por el amor a su hijo. Alba desea seguir trabajando arduamente para que su negocio pueda crecer y fortalecerse cada día, que sea rentable y perdurable en el tiempo, para que le genere la estabilidad económica que requiere para brindar a su pequeño hijo una excelente educación, un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At the age of 31, Alba’s a single mother of a five-year-old son.  She’s worked for the last six years as an employee in several firms working as a counter saleswoman.  She's currently employed in a variety store as manager but she wants to buy the business and has negotiated its purchase with its owner.  This is why she’s asking for the loan which will be used in its entirety to pay for the store so she can go from being an employee to an owner for her wish is to generate higher income to continue meeting her family’s needs since as head of household the entire responsibility rests on her shoulders.

She is noted for her drive, enthusiasm and perseverance which have led her to get ahead on her own motivated by her love for her son.  Alba wants to continue working hard so her business will grow and become stronger and more profitable every day and last over time so that the economic stability she needs to provide excellent education, better well-being and quality of life for her son will be attained.

loans.use: to buy her business.

loans.name: Berna Sugey

texts.es: Berna es una joven soltera de 29 años de edad, habita con su mamá en un barrio de la capital. En la actualidad trabaja para una empresa como impulsadora de ventas de productos varios en los diferentes supermercados de Managua. Berna con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo pudo iniciar la construcción de una habitación, sin embargo no pudo terminar la obra, aun le falta forrar la parte interna de las paredes, está solicitando un crédito para terminar la división de su cuarto y poder comprar los materiales necesarios como laminas de gypsum, dos puertas, tornillos, pinturas y panel metálicos, esta obra le permitirá mayor bienestar a ella y su mamá.
texts.en: Berna, 29, is a single young woman living with her mother in a neighborhood in the capital.  She currently works for a firm that sells products in various Managua supermarkets.  With much effort and work, Berna has managed to start building a room but was unable to finish the project; she still needs to finish the inner walls and is asking for a loan to be able to buy supplies like gypsum sheets, two doors, screws, paint and metal panel to complete the room division.  This project will give her and her mother greater well-being.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Feda

texts.en: Feda was born in 1970. She is married and the mother of seven children. Her husband is retired. One of Feda’s daughters is in her second year studying for a Bachelor of Information and Offices Management, and she is planning to work in her study field after graduation. Feda wants to help her daughter Haneen reach her aim. But she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees in order to help her get one step closer to graduation. For this reason, she applied for this loan. As Feda is a conservative woman, she asked her daughter to take her place in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Askandr Group

texts.en: This is a group of women with initiative, values and good proposals on how to conduct business nowadays. The group is called Askandr and consists of four ladies. They live in Sana`a, Yemen, and each is interested in developing her business. They requested a loan of 160,000 YER. Nawal is 28, married, and the mother of two children. She owns a small house, which she would like to add onto and renovate. She will use her 40,000 YER portion to buy construction materials to use on her house. She hopes this project will be successful.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to use on her house.

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Lan was born in 1967 and has three children who have their own families and are carpenters.  Lan and her husband sell pork in the market to earn a living.  Her husband's income is about 4,000,000 VND and Lan earns about 3,500,000 VND per month.  Lan has done this job for 20 years.  Her family’s total earnings are about 12,000,000 VND per month.  Her challenges in life and work are lacking capital to sell pork and lacking money to build her house.  Her dream is having a more spacious house, and making her family’s business easier.  This loan is one step to help her reach this dream. She can invest in her business to increase revenue and save profit for her family life.  Lan is a hardworking and dynamic woman.
She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2009.  In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time.  In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,976,000 VND to buy more pork to sell in her selling business. 
Other members which are part of Lan's group include the following:
Dung is 41 years old, has two children, and she is a carpenter.  She wants to borrow 10,976,000 VND to buy more wood to do carpentry.
Hoa is 53 years old, has four children, and she breeds pigs.  She wants to borrow 10,976,000 VND to buy more pigs to breed.
Minh is 46 years old, has three children, and is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more wood for her carpentry.
Luan is 40 years old, has three children, and she breeds pigs.  She wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy food for her breeding.

loans.use: to buy more pork to sell in her selling business.

loans.name: Duanis

texts.es: Duanis de 54 años de edad, habita en Barranquilla con su cónyuge y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 21 y 23 años, con quienes sueña ver convertidos en profesionales exitosos y este es justamente su mayor desafío. Ella genera ingresos para aportarle bienestar a su hogar, mediante una actividad comercial, a través de la cual vende ropa y calzado principalmente; su negocio empezó hace 6 años, dando curso a su aptitud de negociante, por eso cuando ganó un premio, compró dos vitrinas y poco a poco las colmó de mercancías cuando empezó a lograr financiamientos y los dirigió a su unidad comercial. En su negocio vende de contado y a crédito, camisas jeans, suéteres y calzado deportivo, trabajando de lunes a domingos, 8 horas diarias. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos del barrio y familiares, para quienes compra de contado y en almacenes que entregan a sus clientes, ofertas significativas en precios y en productos. Su meta es ampliar su negocio hasta convertirlo en un gran almacén, pero su desafió es justamente, tener un capital de trabajo suficiente, para lograr alcanzar su propósito. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará accesorios para damas, artículos de higiene personal, ropa y calzado en un mayor volumen. Con su credikiva tendrá su negocio mucho mas surtido y podrá cumplir los compromisos pactados.
texts.en:
Duanis, 54, lives in Barranquilla with her spouse and two children, ages 21 and 23. She hopes they will become successful professionals, which is her biggest challenge. She earns income to support the household's wellbeing through sales. She primarily sells clothing and shoes in her business, which she started six years ago. She is a skilled businesswoman, which is why upon winning a prize, she bought two glass cabinets and slowly filled them with merchandise when she began to get money, she put it into her business. She sells items on cash and credit, offering shirts, jeans, sweaters, and sports shoes. She works Monday through Sunday, eight hours a day. 

Her main customers are her friends and neighbors in the area. She buys items and stocks up for customers who pay in cash. She offers these regular customers good deals on prices and products. Her goal is to increase her business and turn it into a large store. But, her challenge is the lack of working capital to reach this goal. This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan, which is her first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan, she will buy women's accessories, personal hygiene products, clothing, and shoes in large quantities. This loan will help her business to get stocked up and she will be able to fill requested orders.

loans.use: to buy women's accessories, personal hygiene supplies, clothing, and shoes in large quantities.

loans.name: Hamda

texts.en: Hamda was born in 1957. She is married and the mother of five. Her husband is retired, and one of her sons is in the military. Hamda has been working in trading sheep and their products for seven years. She started her project with a small quantity of sheep and sold the milk that they produced. Now she is seeking to expand her project in order to be more productive and to raise her profit and income. She is planning to buy more sheep to reach that, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more sheep

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is 32 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband currently works in agriculture.  Faten sells clothes and home products, which she has been doing for one year. She also works as a hairdresser. 

Faten is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more clothes and home products to increase her profit and income.  She plans to open her own beauty salon in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and home products

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.es:
Sabrina, de 34 años de edad, está casada con Lander y tiene dos hijos de 16  y 09  años de edad con quienes vive en su casa propia. Sabrina se dedica a la venta de ropas de segunda mano para damas, caballeros y niños de diversos modelos. Tiene más de 03 años dedicándose a éste negocio, y hasta el momento lo realiza sola.
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico, además de estar en casa y puede cuidar a su hijo especial. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias  que le deja, y por tanto desea aumentar su stock de mercadería, así logrará hacer crecer su negocio. Por otro lado, comenta que tiene conocimientos en costura, teniendo planes de comprarse una maquina de coser e incursionar en este negocio, de esa manera generarse más ingresos económicos. Este será su segundo crédito con Kiva y está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con e l monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles comprará un mayor numero de ropas de diversos modelos y tallas.
texts.en:
Sabrina, 34, is married to Lander and has two children who are 16 and 9 years old living with her in a house of her own.  Sabrina works selling second-hand women’s, men’s and children’s clothes in assorted styles.  She’s been in this business for more than three years and to date has been doing it alone.

She likes her business because it generates income while she can stay home caring for her special-needs son.  She considers her business to be quite profitable because of the profits it generates so she’d like to increase her stock merchandise to make the business grow.  On the other hand, she comments that she also has sewing skills so plans to buy a sewing machine to go into this business thus earning additional income.

This will be her second Kiva loan and she’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial support because she’ll feel more confident that way of making business progress.  She will use the 2,000 new soles to buy larger amounts of assorted clothes in various sizes and styles.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Lázaro Antonio

texts.es: Lázaro es padre de familia de dos hijos de las edades de 5 y 9 años, ellos estudian en la escuela primaria y su esposa es ama de casa. Lázaro es albañil de profesión, con sus propias manos ha logrado construir su vivienda por etapas, ya tiene las paredes construidas gracias a los prestamos para la compra de materiales que KIVA le ha concedido. Sin embargo aún falta mucho por hacer, esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de los materiales para la instalación del techo de la casa como perlines y zinc. Con otros préstamos a futuro espera poder concluir la construcción de su hogar.
texts.en:
Lázaro is the father of a family of two children, ages 5 and 9 years.  They are in primary school, and his wife is a homemaker.  

Lázaro is a construction worker by trade, and has been able to build his house in stages with his own two hands.  It already has walls built, thanks to the loans that Kiva has given him to buy materials.  Nevertheless, there is still a lot to do.  He is applying for this loan to buy materials, like purlins and zinc sheets, to install the roof.

With future loans, he hopes to be able to finish building his home.

loans.use: To buy purlins and zinc sheets.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, along with her family. She owns and operates a tricycle service providing transportation in their community to earn a living. Her husband is the one operating it and carrying passengers and baggage to their respective destinations. Her previous loan, which was used to purchase spare parts and tires, has been successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a new loan of 4,500 PHP to repair her existing tricycle. She plans to use the additional profit generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her existing tricycle

loans.name: Heru

texts.en:
The story of Amalia, sister of Heru:

I have lived with my grandmother since I was born. My family's financial condition means we don't have our own house yet. When I was in sixth grade, my mother left us to work abroad. It has been 4 years since then, but there's no news about her. It's difficult to contact her too. During this time my brother also helped me in my education and living expenses. My brother tried to help me by following the Kiva program so I can go back to school to help my grandmother.

Meanwhile, my father went home to his parents and works as a laborer. I have a younger sibling who lives with me and grandmother. My grandmother has been the one who is taking care of us and funding our study. I hope I can do something for her. It should be great if I can keep on studying without being more of a  burden for her. In the picture, Heru and his sister, Amalia.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is taking a loan to buy cosmetics such as facial cream, face powder, lipstick, nail polish, etc.

Shazia is a 39-year-old married woman, living with her husband and 3 children. 

Her husband has an ordinary job and earns very low income, which is the reason she decided to open a parlor at home so that she could do something to financially help her husband.  Through the beauty salon she is taking an active part to increase the monthly income of her family.  She is famous for bridal makeovers.  Over time her beauty products are gradually running out and she wants to buy more cosmetic products for her beauty salon. 
Therefore, Shazia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she would be able to buy new cosmetic products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotions, etc.

Shazia says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as facial cream, face powder, lipstick, and nail polish for her parlor.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal was born in 1970. She is married and is a mother of six children. Her husband works in agriculture. 

Amal has been selling clothes for one year. She started her business with a small amount of money, selling clothes to her neighbors and friends. 

Now, she is planning to add new products to her business, such as perfumes and accessories, in order to raise her sales and income to be a good supporter for her husband, in covering their children's needs and in improving their living conditions. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en: Cerelina is 48 years old from the municipality of Talibon, Bohol. She is married and her husband is a fisherman. He also sell seashells and sea cucumber. On the other hand, Cerelina helps by operating a Sari-sari (variety) store business.  This existed for 25 years now and she sell items like soy sauce, detergent, cooking oil, salt, vinegar, canned goods and noodles. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of canned goods, sugar, shampoo, coffee, seasoning and materials for store renovation. She hopes that someday she can continue to improve and expand her  business for her three children’s education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, sugar, shampoo, coffee, seasoning and materials for store renovation

loans.name: Carla Jose

texts.es: Carla es una jovencita con 22 años de edad, estudia la carrera de comunicación social,  trabaja en tele ventas para una empresa de Call Center, por este medio se apoya para los pagos de sus gastos universitarios. Carla requiere del apoyo de préstamo para poder entrar al curso de titulación de su carrera que esta por culminar, que le ayudara a mejorar su curriculum para optar por un empleo con un mejor salario del que tiene en la actualidad.
texts.en:
Carla, 22, studies social communication.  She works in telephone sales for a call center company to support herself and pay her school expenses.

Carla needs the support of the loan to be able to take the course to register her degree for the program she's about to finish.  This will help her improve her résumé and aim for a job with a better salary than she has currently.

loans.use: to register her degree

loans.name: Rusmini

texts.en:
This is the story of Heni, daughter of Rusmini:

I like my vocational lesson very much: accounting. The reason is I am interested in studying about company financials. Because I am in the first year of school, formerly I found a little bit of difficulty to make the adaptation with new friends and a new environment. But, so far, so good. Truly, my real problem is paying the school fee. My parents are only poor farmers. They do not have enough money to fulfill my school expenses.

To all generous Kiva lenders, I would like to ask you to help me so that I can reach my life dreams and have a better life than at present. My hometown is Jeruklegi Kulon, Cilacap Regency, Central Java Province. It is geographically hilly, tranquil and far away from a big city. The population is rare. 

My mother is a farmer, and my father is a farmer too. My mother’s salary per month is only Rp (Rupiah) 400,000. The amount of children in the family is two. Their ages are 15 and 19 years old (including me). I am the only one who is still studying at school. If I am given the Kiva loan from lenders, I will spend it to pay my school fees.

At school, most of my time table is accounting lessons because my majority is accounting. Besides that, I also learn other lessons, such as English, civil, math, Indonesian language and so on. I chose this study program because someday I want to be a financial administrator at a company. The fun thing at school is I have and meet new things and new friends.
In the picture, Rusmini and her daughter, Heni.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Sayem

texts.en:
This is the story of Rava, daughter of Sayem:

My favourite lesson is entrepreneurship. Learning it, I am able to know about how to build and manage a company on my own and also how to be a good entrepreneur. My problem is financial. My family is poor and cannot pay the school fee. Before knowing about Kiva, I had no hope to continue my study, but after knowing it, I have new hope to continue my study. It’s like the light of a candle in the dark. I am sure, only with the education that can change my life, I will have a better future.

We have a house with a broken and leaking roof, and when the rain comes, there are many rain water drops in the house. My hometown is Jeruklegi Wetan village, Jeruklegi Subdistric, Cilacap Regency, Central Java Province. Geographically hilly and rocky, the road is bad and far away from a big city. 

My mother is a walker food seller. Their salary per month is only Rp (Rupiah) 600,000. The job of my father is a brick layer. He works only when someone needs him to build or renovate something, such as a house, walls, etc. But if no one employs him, he is jobless.The amount of children in family is four. Their ages are 23, 22, 15 (me), and 6 years old. The children who still study at school are I and my younger sister, Salsa. If I am given the Kiva loan from lenders, I will spend it to pay my school fees.

At school, most of my time table is accounting lessons because my majority is accounting. Besides that, I also learn other lessons, such as English, civil, math, Indonesian language and so on. I chose this study program because someday I want to be a financial administrator at a company. The fun thing at school is I have and meet new things and new friends.

In the picture, Sayem and her daughter, Rava.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.
